title: Zapier MCP 2.0: When AI Actually Does the Work
content:
### Zapier MCP 2.0: When AI Actually Does the¬†Work


Picture this: You're between meetings when you realize you forgot to schedule Friday's client discovery session. Normally, you'd frantically switch between apps‚Äîcalendar, Drive folder, WhatsApp‚Äîburning 15 minutes on routine tasks.

Now imagine telling your AI: "Schedule a 45-minute Discovery Session with [Client Name] & [Company Name]for this Friday afternoon, create a shared project folder, and notify him via WhatsApp." In less than a minute, it's done.

This is Zapier MCP 2.0, and I've been testing it. Here's what actually works.


### From Chatbot to Digital¬†Employee


AI has been stuck in conversation mode. ChatGPT writes emails but can't send them. Claude plans schedules but can't create calendar events. These tools were consultants trapped without execution power.

The Model Context Protocol (MCP) changes this by connecting AI to real applications.

And, Zapier MCP 2.0 provides access to 8,000+ apps and 30,000+ actions, transforming AI from advisor to executor.

Key MCP 2.0 improvements:

Choose Zapier Agents for background automation that runs multi-step processes independently. Choose MCP 2.0 for real-time, conversational control where you stay in Claude and direct actions as you work.


### Real-World Testing: What Actually¬†Works


I tested MCP 2.0 with actual business scenarios. Here's what works, what doesn't, and what you need to know.

Test Case 1: Meeting Setup¬†Workflow

The Challenge: Create a complete business meeting workflow‚Äîcalendar, file organization, client communication‚Äîfrom a single command.

The Command: ‚ÄúSchedule a 45-minute Discovery Session with Directing Business & NGMF for this Friday afternoon, create a shared project folder, and notify <email-id> via WhatsApp‚Äù

Results: The system understood the request and began coordinating actions. It created the calendar event "Discovery Session - [Directing Business] & [NGMF]" for Friday afternoon, generated a Google Drive folder named "Discovery Session - Directing Business & NGMF Project" with shared permissions, and prepared a WhatsApp message with calendar invite and folder link.

The catch: Execution required pre-configured action names and IDs in the MCP dashboard. Without these specific configurations, the AI understood intent but couldn't complete the automated sequence.

Reality: Multi-service workflows work when properly set up, but require upfront configuration. This isn't "just talk and everything happens"‚Äîit needs thoughtful preparation.

Test Case 2: WordPress Content¬†Creation

The Command: "Review this draft document about Zapier MCP and create a WordPress post"

Results: This worked smoothly. The AI analyzed my draft content, then created a complete WordPress post:

The AI didn't just copy-paste‚Äîit actively reviewed the draft for completeness and applied proper formatting.

Key Insight: Single-service integrations work reliably. Multi-platform coordination works but needs specific setup.

Performance Lessons

What works well:

What needs work:

Bottom line: Start simple. Master single-service automations before building complex workflows.


### Setup Guide: Getting¬†Started


Prerequisites

MCP 2.0 includes 300 monthly tool calls on the free tier‚Äîadequate for testing and moderate use. Each AI action counts against this quota.

Start with non-critical applications while building confidence. WordPress, Google Calendar, and Gmail work reliably as starting points.

Implementation Steps

2. Configure Actions Click "+ Add tool" and search for your application. Use specific action names like "Schedule Client Discovery Call" rather than generic "Create Event." Your AI recognizes descriptive names more reliably.

Fill mandatory fields and consider which optional fields the AI should handle automatically versus requiring specific input each time.

3. Connect to Claude Copy your MCP server URL ‚Üí Open Claude.ai ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Integrations ‚Üí Add more ‚Üí Paste URL ‚Üí Name clearly ‚Üí Accept security notice.

Start new Claude conversation ‚Üí Click search/tools icon ‚Üí Find your MCP server ‚Üí Click Connect ‚Üí Approve connection.

‚Ä¶you should the number of tools besides Zapier like any other MCP Server.

Advanced Setup

Multi-Server Management: Create separate servers for different departments or security levels. Marketing gets social media tools, finance gets database access.

Rate Limit Management: Monitor usage through the MCP dashboard. Prioritize valuable automations if approaching the 300 monthly limit.


### Performance Reality: What Works and What¬†Doesn't


Current Limitations

Response Times: Single actions complete in 5‚Äì10 seconds. Multi-service workflows take more than a minute.

Reliability: Simple actions succeed 95%+ of the time. Complex workflows drop to 80-85% due to API timeouts or rate limiting.

Enterprise Restrictions: Limited Enterprise account support remains the biggest business limitation.

Configuration Requirements: Unlike natural conversation, MCP 2.0 works best with pre-configured specific actions. You can't ask it to "do something with my CRM"‚Äîyou need "Update Lead Status in HubSpot."

Optimization Strategies

Start Small: Begin with single actions providing immediate value‚Äîcreating posts, scheduling events, sending emails.

Naming Conventions: Use "Create-Blog-Post-Draft" or "Schedule-Team-Meeting" rather than generic names.

Maintain Fallbacks: For critical workflows, keep manual backup processes.

Monitor Regularly: Check dashboard for failed actions, quota usage, and integration health.

MCP 2.0 vs Alternatives


### The Current¬†Reality


We're at the early stages of AI that acts rather than just advises. Based on testing, this technology works but rewards thoughtful implementation over hasty deployment.

Business Impact

In my own workflows, I reduced manual coordination time by around 25%, particularly in content creation, meeting setup, and client communications, after properly configuring MCP 2.0. The key is ‚Äúeffectively‚Äù‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääsuccess depends on thoughtful setup and customization.

The biggest impact isn‚Äôt for large enterprises with automation teams‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääit‚Äôs for small businesses and solo professionals, who previously couldn‚Äôt justify the cost or effort of custom integrations but can now access powerful automation with minimal setup.

What's Improving

App Growth: Current 8,000+ apps expanding rapidly AI Reasoning: Better context understanding to reduce configuration needsEnterprise Features: Advanced security and team management in development Reliability: Ongoing improvements to integration stability


### Implementation Strategy


Month 1: Start with single-service integrations providing immediate value. Master the setup process.

Months 2-3: Add complementary services and simple multi-step workflows. Connect related applications.

Month 3+: Develop sophisticated workflows. Implement monitoring procedures.

Long-term: Stay engaged with the community and development roadmap. Early adopters who learn effective patterns gain competitive advantages.


### The Bottom¬†Line


That frantic meeting-coordination scenario from the beginning isn't just a productivity problem‚Äîit's a stress and professionalism problem that limits business growth.

MCP 2.0 doesn't just save time; it changes how you work. When AI executes business tasks while you focus on strategy and relationships, you operate at a higher level.

Is it perfect? No. Testing revealed setup requirements and occasional reliability issues that remind you this is emerging technology. But it's capable enough to cross a crucial threshold: AI can now reliably take real-world actions in business applications.

The WordPress creation worked smoothly. The meeting workflow succeeded with minor manual intervention. Both demonstrated we've moved beyond AI that just provides advice to AI that executes tasks.

Your AI assistant is ready to become your AI employee. The question isn't whether this technology will transform routine business tasks‚Äîit's whether you'll master it early or catch up later.

Ready to¬†start?

Visit zapier.com/mcp to set up your first server, or try these templates from my testing:

The move from AI that talks to AI that acts starts with one automation.

title: Qwen 3-Omni and the Evolution of Native Multimodal AI: From Complex Pipelines to Unified Processing
content:
### Qwen 3-Omni and the Evolution of Native Multimodal AI: From Complex Pipelines to Unified Processing


That line captures the difference between raw perception and true understanding. It‚Äôs also a fitting way to think about the shift toward multimodal AI. Models like Qwen3-Omni aren‚Äôt just taking in text, images, and audio separately‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääthey‚Äôre learning to connect them, to observe in a way that feels closer to how humans make sense of the world.


### Understanding Multimodal Models


What is a Multimodal Model?

A multimodal model processes multiple input types‚Ää‚Äî‚Äätext, images, audio, and video‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääsimultaneously, moving beyond traditional unimodal systems that handle only one data type in isolation. These systems mirror human cognition, which processes visual and auditory inputs in parallel and generates responses through various means including textual expression and vocalization.

The inspiration comes from human learning patterns where complementary specialization and cross-modal synergy improve learning efficiency. Unlike earlier AI systems that required separate models for each modality, multimodal models create unified representations that can draw connections across different types of information.

Key Advantages of Multimodal Models

Enhanced Cross-Modal Reasoning: These models understand relationships between different information types‚Ää‚Äî‚Äähow spoken words relate to visual elements in video, or how textual descriptions complement audio cues.

Richer Contextual Understanding: Processing multiple data streams simultaneously creates more comprehensive content understanding. Video analysis benefits from combining visual scenes, audio dialogue, and text overlays into unified comprehension.

Reduced System Complexity: Single-model integration replaces orchestration of multiple specialized systems, simplifying design, deployment, and maintenance.

Lower End-to-End Latency: Processing modalities within one model eliminates sequential processing stages and intermediate data transfers.

Improved Performance Through Modality Synergy: Well-designed multimodal models often achieve better performance on individual modalities than specialized single-modal models through mutual enhancement during training.


### Building Multimodal Models from Ground Up: Training Methodologies


Early Integration Strategy

Effective multimodal models require careful timing of when different modalities are introduced during training. The most successful approach mixes unimodal and cross-modal data during early text pretraining stages, rather than adding multimodal capabilities later.

This early integration allows models to develop unified representations from the beginning. Critical to success is the non-degradation principle‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääadding multimodal capabilities should not diminish performance on individual modalities. This requires meticulous control including identical training corpora, aligned learning schedules, matched batch sizes, and normalized training epochs through careful data sampling.

Training Pipeline Architecture

Modern multimodal training follows a multi-stage approach ensuring capability and stability across modalities.

Pre-training establishes basic multimodal representations through exposure to diverse data, requiring careful balance across modalities while maintaining computational efficiency.

Post-training refines capabilities through Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT), which bridges gaps between pretrained representations and downstream tasks. Strong-to-Weak Distillation follows with off-policy distillation combining teacher model outputs, then on-policy distillation where student models generate responses aligned with teacher outputs through KL divergence minimization.

GSPO (Generalized Self-Play Optimization) provides comprehensive enhancement through sophisticated reward systems‚Ää‚Äî‚Äärule-based rewards for verifiable tasks and model-based rewards for subjective multimodal tasks through LLM-as-a-judge protocols.

Data Requirements and¬†Scaling

Modern systems require massive datasets. Qwen 3-Omni uses 20 million hours of supervised audio data for audio encoder training alone. Balanced modality training requires sophisticated sampling strategies that normalize exposure across input types while accounting for varying information density and processing requirements.


### Qwen 3-Omni: Technical Deep Dive and Core¬†Features


Architecture: Thinker-Talker MoE¬†Design

Qwen 3-Omni employs a Thinker-Talker Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) architecture that reimagines multimodal processing.

The Thinker component handles text generation and multimodal reasoning, processing inputs from all modalities and generating textual responses based on cross-modal understanding.

The Talker component focuses on streaming speech generation using a multi-codebook scheme enabling real-time audio output. Critically, the Talker operates independently of Thinker‚Äôs text representations, conditioning directly on audio and visual features. This enables efficient textual processing, supports complex tasks like preserving prosody in speech translation, and allows external modules to intervene for RAG integration or safety filtering.

The decoupled architecture permits independent system prompts, enabling separate control of response style and audio characteristics.

Advanced Technical Components

AuT (Audio Transformer) is an attention-encoder-decoder model with 0.6B parameters, trained from scratch on 20 million hours of supervised audio data. The encoder provides general-purpose audio representations at 12.5Hz token rate. Training combines 80% Chinese and English pseudo-labeled ASR data, 10% other language ASR data, and 10% audio understanding data.

Vision encoder, initialized from SigLIP2-So400m, underwent training on mixed image and video data, enabling understanding of both static visual elements and temporal sequences.

TM-RoPE (Time-aligned Multimodal Rotary Position Embedding) addresses temporal alignment challenges by integrating absolute temporal information, allowing joint modeling of multimodal audiovisual streams while treating video frames as sequences with increasing temporal IDs.

Code2Wav renderer enables frame-by-frame streaming synthesis through a lightweight causal ConvNet, replacing computationally intensive block-wise diffusion methods.

Performance Specifications

Qwen 3-Omni achieves 234ms first-packet latency for streaming applications, suitable for real-time interaction. Extended context handling processes audio recordings up to 40+ minutes for ASR and understanding tasks.

Multilingual support spans 119 text languages, 19 languages for speech recognition, and 10 for speech synthesis. Operating at 30B-A3B parameter scale with MoE architecture balances capability with computational efficiency through sparse activation patterns.


### Qwen 3-Omni:¬†Hands-on


Audio Captioning

Qwen 3-Omni did a good job of understanding a Telugu (Indian language) audio, which included identifying a coastal dialect of the speaker.

Video analysis

Qwen does a good job of identifying each scene in the video (provided as an¬†.mp4 upload), including the shot breakdown‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ and the transcript itself.

Multimodal AI¬†: Prop¬†analysis

Qwen3-Omni, analyses a video scene and generate a detailed list of props needed to recreate it. By understanding the visual elements, the AI provides specific recommendations for authentic Japanese clothing, a katana, a natural grassy field, and appropriate lighting, highlighting its practical application in visual project planning.

Checking Youtube Compliance for a¬†video

I used the same video as in my previous article on Video RAG to compare the results.

Unfortunately, I couldn‚Äôt get the model to work in Google Colab and had to rely on Qwen Chat.

The results were satisfactory, with good text extraction, but not ideal, as the model didn‚Äôt reference exact points in the video. This may require additional prompting and further checks on the model‚Äôs inference.


### Comparative Analysis: Qwen 3-Omni vs. Gemini 2.5¬†Pro


Benchmark Performance Comparison

Audio and Audio-Visual Performance: Qwen 3-Omni achieves state-of-the-art results on 32 out of 36 audio and audio-visual benchmarks, matching or exceeding Gemini 2.5 Pro, Seed-ASR, and GPT-4o-Transcribe performance.

Text and Vision Parity: Qwen 3-Omni maintains performance parity with specialized unimodal models within the Qwen series, demonstrating the non-degradation principle where multimodal capabilities don‚Äôt compromise single-modality effectiveness.

Cross-Modal Reasoning: Both models excel through different approaches‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäQwen 3-Omni‚Äôs integrated training enables temporal understanding, while Gemini 2.5 Pro‚Äôs sparse MoE provides flexible content routing.

Architectural Differences

Qwen 3-Omni uses integrated end-to-end training focused on non-degradation, with Thinker-Talker architecture enabling specialized optimization for reasoning versus generation while maintaining unified understanding.

Gemini 2.5 Pro employs sparse MoE transformers with native multimodal support, dynamically routing tokens to parameter subsets based on content type for efficient scaling.

Both support extensive context lengths (1M+ tokens), but differ in output capabilities‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäQwen 3-Omni emphasizes native audio generation while Gemini 2.5 Pro offers broader tool integration.


### Video RAG Evolution: From Pipeline to Native Processing


Traditional Video RAG Pipelines

Early video RAG solutions relied on multi-stage pipelines, decomposing video into separate components before analysis:

This architecture provided modularity but came with substantial infrastructure overhead. Multiple specialized models had to be orchestrated, introducing complexity, additional storage for intermediate embeddings, and multiple points of failure.

Embedding Model‚Äôs¬†Role

BridgeTower exemplified this pipeline style by acting as a specialized embedding model. Its innovation lay in cross-modal alignment: connecting semantic information across visual and textual depths using multi-layer bridging.


### Qwen3-Omni: Making Embedding Model Redundant


Native Temporal Understanding

Qwen3-Omni introduces a unified, omni-modal architecture with built-in support for video and audio streams:

This design removes the need for separate embedding models like BridgeTower, since temporal, visual, and auditory signals are fused natively within the model.

Unified Architecture Benefits

Practical Implementation Advantages


### Implications for the Future of Multimodal AI


The rise of unified models like Qwen3-Omni reflects a broader shift in AI: moving away from complex, fragile pipelines toward integrated systems. Capabilities that once required stitching together multiple tools‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääspeech recognition, video analysis, image understanding‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääare increasingly available within a single model. What used to be cutting-edge is becoming baseline.

This shift matters because it lowers the barriers to building multimodal applications. In the past, only well-funded teams with deep engineering resources could assemble and maintain multimodal stacks. With simpler, native architectures, smaller teams can now experiment, innovate, and deploy without the same infrastructure burden.

As these models become more capable, the competitive edge won‚Äôt come from access to raw functionality alone‚Ää‚Äî‚Äämost systems will have that. Instead, the advantage will lie in how well organizations integrate these capabilities into real-world workflows, balance user experience with trust and safety, and adapt to specific domains.

AI doesn‚Äôt need to replace human observation, but it can benefit from learning the same lesson Holmes offered Watson: seeing is not enough.

With multimodal systems like Qwen3-Omni, we‚Äôre starting to see that shift, from isolated inputs to something more integrated, a step closer to genuine observation.

References:

By Lakshmi narayana .U on September 25, 2025.

title: Exploring Wealth and Wisdom: Learnings from Chekhov‚Äôs ‚ÄúBet‚Äù
content:
### Exploring Wealth and Wisdom: Learnings from Chekhov‚Äôs ‚ÄúBet‚Äù



### Introduction


Anton Chekhov‚Äôs ‚ÄúBet‚Äù casts a spell with its engaging plot and its themes of wealth and knowledge that are strikingly relevant even today. My first brush with this tale was not through its original literary form, but through a TV episode in ‚ÄúKatha Sagar,‚Äù which lingered in my thoughts, eventually drawing me back to the story itself, sparking reflections on its profound themes.

A Glimpse into¬†‚ÄúBet‚Äù

‚ÄúBet‚Äù unfolds with a spirited argument at a banker‚Äôs party, where a lawyer asserts that any kind of life is better than no life at all, opposing the death penalty, and favouring life imprisonment. The banker, in disagreement, offers a bet of two million rubles, challenging the lawyer to undergo voluntary imprisonment for fifteen years with the goal to prove the value and resilience of human spirit under isolation. The lawyer accepts, and what follows is a transformative journey through solitude, knowledge acquisition, and eventual disdain for material wealth.

My Personal Encounter with¬†‚ÄúBet‚Äù

I first watched ‚ÄúBet‚Äù as an episode in ‚ÄúKatha Sagar,‚Äù with compelling performances by Kulbhushan Kharbanda and Sachin. It wasn‚Äôt a mere watch but a thought-provoking encounter that stayed with me, provoking thoughts about wealth and wisdom through years. Recently, I re-engaged with the story, reading Chekhov‚Äôs original words and even seeking out the episode in a DVD collection of ‚ÄúKatha Sagar‚Äù‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääcuriously, it was absent.

Finding Depth in Simplicity

The lawyer‚Äôs chosen solitude becomes a catalyst for self-discovery and simplicity, demonstrating that life, devoid of material entanglements, can foster profound insights and satisfaction. The story prompts us to contemplate: Can genuine happiness bloom from a life unperturbed by materialistic chaos?

Knowledge as Fulfillment

Through his isolation, the lawyer explores worlds within worlds through books, signifying that a quest for knowledge can pave the way to a deeply satisfying existence. This proposition begs our collective pondering: Can knowledge-seeking indeed carve a fulfilling pathway amid our contemporary diversions?

Stoicism: Finding Peace¬†within

The lawyer‚Äôs rejection of the material reward showcases a serene stoicism, illustrating that a detachment from materialistic wants can usher in a unique tranquility and happiness. A potent thought to ruminate upon: Does stoicism hold the unsung key to a peaceful existence amidst our material-laden societal norms?

Modern Insights from a Timeless¬†Tale

‚ÄúBet‚Äù with its discerning characters and philosophical undertones extends a mirror, encouraging reflections on our own life choices and paths in today‚Äôs rapid, interconnected world. The disparate life philosophies embodied by the lawyer and banker cast a reflective light upon our societal and personal journeys.

Conclusion: Thoughts and Looking¬†Ahead

‚ÄúBet‚Äù offers an undying philosophical dialogue, coaxing its readers into a realm of contemplation regarding wealth, wisdom, and true fulfillment. Even though my initiation into this narrative was through a TV series, the nuanced layers of the written tale have seeded deep, reflective thoughts, especially against the backdrop of our modern, material-driven existence. May this timeless narrative continue to encourage discussions and reflections on the perpetual dialogue between materialistic and intellectual/spiritual pursuits, amid our evolving societal and individual landscapes.

By Lakshmi narayana .U on October 13, 2023.

title: MIT Technology Review‚Äôs Innovators Under 35: The Marvel Multiverse of Innovation
content:
### MIT Technology Review‚Äôs Innovators Under 35: The Marvel Multiverse of Innovation


Like heroes scattered across the Marvel multiverse, each tackling threats in their own reality, MIT Technology Review‚Äôs Innovators Under 35 class of 2025 represents brilliant minds working in parallel dimensions of science. This year‚Äôs selection was particularly competitive‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääexpert judges and newsroom staff reviewed hundreds of nominees from around the world, ultimately recognizing 35 extraordinary individuals under age 35 who are brimming with ideas for how to crack humanity‚Äôs toughest problems.

These scientists, inventors, and entrepreneurs span the full spectrum of innovation: some are launching companies while others advance breakthrough research in academic labs. All share a unified mission to help mitigate climate change, accelerate scientific progress, and alleviate human suffering from disease. One standout (Sneha Goenka) has even been named the 2025 Innovator of the Year, representing exceptional achievement in this already elite group.

Just as each Marvel hero wields distinct powers‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäTony Stark‚Äôs technology, Wanda‚Äôs reality manipulation, or Stephen Strange‚Äôs mastery of the mystic arts‚Ää‚Äî‚Äätoday‚Äôs young innovators command equally impressive abilities: AI models that generate entirely new materials, bioluminescent wallpaper for space missions, and microscopic pacemakers that dissolve harmlessly after healing hearts.


### The Complete Roster of Real-World Heroes


MIT Technology Review Innovators Under¬†35‚Äì2025

The complete roster of young innovators tackling humanity‚Äôs greatest challenges across five key dimensions of science and technology.

Materials Science

Artificial Intelligence

Biotechnology

Climate and Energy

What makes this year‚Äôs class particularly remarkable isn‚Äôt just individual excellence‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääit‚Äôs how their innovations create ripple effects across scientific dimensions. Tim Brooks‚Äôs video generation AI could revolutionize how we visualize scientific concepts. Tian Xie‚Äôs material-generating AI might discover substances that make Pierre Forin‚Äôs carbon capture systems more efficient. Yamin Zhang‚Äôs biodegradable pacemakers could benefit from the health-sensing fabrics developed by Irmandy Wicaksono.

Unlike fictional heroes who occasionally cross dimensions for epic team-ups, these real-world innovators are already creating cascading breakthroughs. AI advances enable new materials discovery, which powers better climate solutions, which support the biotechnology and space exploration others are pioneering.

Many of these innovators already lead companies implementing their breakthroughs commercially. This isn‚Äôt distant science fiction‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääthese are solutions entering our reality within years, not decades. The fact that such young scientists are already translating laboratory discoveries into market applications suggests we‚Äôre witnessing a generational shift in how quickly innovation moves from concept to implementation.


### The Legacy Continues


The Innovators Under 35 program represents more than annual recognition‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääit‚Äôs a testament to the ongoing evolution of scientific leadership. Julia R. Greer, now a judge for the program, was herself honored in 2008 as a materials scientist. Her journey from honoree to judge illustrates how today‚Äôs young innovators become tomorrow‚Äôs scientific leaders and mentors.

This continuity becomes especially important as the challenges facing humanity grow more complex. As Greer noted in her recent analysis, fundamental research funding faces increasing pressure in an era focused on short-term returns. Yet the technologies these innovators are developing today often rest on decades of basic research‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääthe kind that requires sustained investment and long-term vision.


### Staying Connected to the¬†Future


As these innovators‚Äô breakthroughs reshape industries, policies, and fields like healthcare and climate action, understanding their implications grows more critical.

Quality science journalism, like MIT Technology Review, provides essential analysis to navigate this complex landscape, illuminating both the breakthroughs and their societal impact. In an era where scientific literacy shapes decisions on technology, investment, and policy, staying informed through authoritative reporting is vital.

As these 35 innovators advance their groundbreaking work, following their progress is key to understanding our rapidly evolving technological future.

This overview highlights key innovations from MIT Technology Review‚Äôs comprehensive Innovators Under 35 2025 feature, which includes detailed profiles, technical analysis, and insights into the future implications of each breakthrough.

title: Open-Source AI Platforms Challenge Proprietary Giants with Innovative Tools Like DeerFlow
content:
Open-Source AI Platforms Challenge Proprietary Giants with Innovative Tools Like DeerFlow

Over the past year, open-source AI platforms have been rapidly closing the gap with proprietary systems like OpenAI‚Äôs ChatGPT and Anthropic‚Äôs Claude, delivering powerful features such as autonomous AI agents and deep research capabilities that rival closed-source models. Projects like DeepSeek‚Äôs R1 and OpenManus, a community-built alternative to the invite-only Manus AI agent launched in March 2024, showcase the strength of collaborative development. OpenManus, created by the MetaGPT community in mere hours, matches proprietary agents in tasks like travel planning, stock analysis, and coding, leveraging models like GPT-4o. These advancements, powered by frameworks like Hugging Face‚Äôs Transformers, highlight the growing accessibility and innovation in open-source AI, setting the stage for groundbreaking tools like DeerFlow, which pushes the boundaries of agentic workflows and research automation even further.

The Rise of DeerFlow: A Game-Changer in Research Automation

DeerFlow, an open-source multi-agent framework developed by ByteDance and released in May 2025, exemplifies how open-source AI is redefining research automation. Built on LangChain and LangGraph, DeerFlow coordinates specialized AI agents to tackle complex research tasks with unprecedented efficiency, transparency, and scalability. Unlike traditional large language models (LLMs) that operate as singular entities, DeerFlow employs a modular, multi-agent architecture where each agent focuses on specific functions such as task planning, knowledge retrieval, code execution, or report synthesis. This directed graph-based approach, orchestrated by LangGraph, ensures robust task coordination and data flow, making DeerFlow ideal for academic, corporate, and R&D environments.

Key Features of DeerFlow

Real-World Applications

DeerFlow‚Äôs versatility makes it a powerful tool across various domains. In academia, researchers can use it to conduct systematic literature reviews, synthesize data, and generate structured reports. For example, a study on Nanjing‚Äôs culinary history leveraged DeerFlow‚Äôs multi-agent system to uncover cultural narratives and produce rich content with imagery. In corporate R&D, DeerFlow automates data aggregation and analysis, enabling teams to focus on strategic decision-making. Its integration with MCP supports enterprise applications like inventory monitoring or supply chain optimization, where agents predict disruptions and adjust schedules autonomously. Freelance consultants and data scientists can also use DeerFlow to streamline tasks like market analysis or content creation, benefiting from its customizable workflows.

How DeerFlow Compares to Proprietary Platforms

Proprietary platforms like OpenAI and Claude have long dominated AI due to their vast resources and closed ecosystems. However, DeerFlow and other open-source frameworks challenge this dominance by offering comparable performance at a lower cost. For instance, DeepCoder-14B-Preview, an open-source model, achieves coding accuracy similar to OpenAI‚Äôs o3-mini, while DeerFlow‚Äôs multi-agent system rivals Claude‚Äôs ability to handle complex tasks. Unlike proprietary systems, DeerFlow‚Äôs open-source nature allows users to inspect and modify its architecture, ensuring transparency and reducing dependency on black-box solutions. Additionally, its community-driven approach fosters rapid innovation, as seen in the quick development of tools like OpenManus.

The Broader Impact of Open-Source AI

The rise of tools like DeerFlow underscores the transformative potential of open-source AI. By democratizing access to advanced technologies, these platforms empower smaller organizations, independent researchers, and developers in resource-constrained regions to compete with industry giants. The collaborative ethos of open-source communities accelerates innovation, as developers worldwide contribute to frameworks like LangChain and Hugging Face, which DeerFlow builds upon. Moreover, open-source AI promotes ethical development by allowing scrutiny of algorithms, reducing the risk of biases inherent in proprietary systems. As Gartner predicts, by 2028, 33% of enterprise software will incorporate agentic AI, with open-source frameworks like DeerFlow leading the charge in research and automation.

Challenges and Future Directions

Despite its strengths, DeerFlow faces challenges common to open-source projects. Integrating disparate tools and ensuring compatibility across environments can be complex, requiring technical expertise. Additionally, while its human-in-the-loop design mitigates errors, agents may occasionally misinterpret data or hallucinate sources, necessitating robust validation mechanisms. Future developments could focus on enhancing DeerFlow‚Äôs reinforcement learning capabilities, enabling agents to adapt dynamically to unpredictable tasks, as seen in OpenAI‚Äôs Deep Research tool. Expanding support for additional LLMs and integrating advanced visualization tools could further broaden its appeal.

DeerFlow represents a pivotal moment in the evolution of open-source AI, offering a modular, transparent, and powerful framework that rivals proprietary platforms. Its multi-agent architecture, human-in-the-loop design, and robust tool integration make it a go-to solution for deep research and automation, from academic studies to enterprise workflows. As open-source platforms like DeerFlow continue to innovate, they are not only catching up with but also redefining the standards set by proprietary giants. By fostering collaboration and accessibility, DeerFlow and its peers are paving the way for a more inclusive and dynamic AI ecosystem, where innovation knows no bounds. For those eager to explore its capabilities, DeerFlow‚Äôs GitHub repository and web UI provide a gateway to transforming research workflows today.

Note: The article reflects information available as of May 13, 2025, and critically examines the capabilities of open-source AI while acknowledging the strengths and limitations of both open-source and proprietary platforms.

title: Editing Reality Like Doctor Strange: How Qwen-Image Delivers Surgical Precision‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäWithout the Magic
content:
### Editing Reality Like Doctor Strange: How Qwen-Image Delivers Surgical Precision‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäWithout the¬†Magic


When Doctor Strange bends reality on screen‚Ää‚Äî‚Äärewinding time, reshaping landscapes, and fixing the tiniest details without breaking the world‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääwe lean forward in awe. That kind of precision feels like pure sorcery.

In the world of image editing, that same paradox has been a long-standing challenge: how do you make a small, precise change without disturbing everything around it? Traditional tools like Photoshop offer layers, masks, and painstaking manual control. They get the job done, but only with skill and patience. Diffusion models such as Stable Diffusion or MidJourney, meanwhile, excel at generating whole new scenes but struggle with fine edits‚Ää‚Äî‚Äächanging just one word on a sign or the color of a shirt often introduces unwanted artifacts elsewhere.

This is where Qwen-Image, a new open-source model from Alibaba‚Äôs Qwen team, comes in. It doesn‚Äôt conjure portals or manipulate time, but it does deliver something almost as magical: the ability to carry out precise, prompt-driven edits while preserving the surrounding image.


### Why Image Editing Needed a New¬†Playbook


To understand why Qwen-Image is significant, it helps to look at the status quo.

Traditional editing tools rely heavily on human effort. Photoshop users spend hours creating masks, layering adjustments, and manually tweaking details. The results can be perfect, but the process is slow and requires expertise.

Diffusion models such as Stable Diffusion, DALL¬∑E, and MidJourney opened up new creative workflows. They‚Äôre great for generating brand-new images from text prompts, but struggle when asked to make localized changes to an existing image. Ask them to change a single word in a poster, and you‚Äôll often find the surrounding text distorted or the style inconsistent.

Qwen-Image was built specifically for precision. It shines in scenarios where accuracy matters: text rendering (especially Chinese and English), localized object edits, and stylistic transformations that preserve layout.

The key idea? Make surgical edits without collateral damage.


### The Technical Core: How Qwen-Image Works


Dual-Stream Architecture

A cornerstone of Qwen-Image‚Äôs precision is its dual-stream MMDiT (Multimodal Diffusion Transformer) architecture. Unlike standard diffusion pipelines, it processes images along two complementary streams.

Semantic Stream (Qwen2.5-VL Encoder) Captures what the image contains‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääits objects, layout, and meaning. Example: understands that ‚Äúthe man‚Äôs tie‚Äù is different from ‚Äúthe suit‚Äù or ‚Äúthe background.‚Äù

Visual Stream (VAE Encoder)Preserves how the image looks‚Ää‚Äî‚Äätextures, brushstrokes, colors, fonts. Example: the silk sheen of a tie or the delicate ink strokes of Chinese calligraphy.

These two streams meet in the MMDiT backbone. By aligning semantics with appearance, the model knows both what needs to change and what must stay untouched.

üé• Think of it like Doctor Strange separating his astral form (semantics) from his body (appearance). Both must align perfectly for reality to remain coherent.

Learning Precision Through Multi-Task Training

Architecture is only half the story. Training is equally important, and Qwen-Image uses a multi-task learning approach that includes three key objectives:

Text-to-Image (T2I) ‚Üí Teaches the model to generate images from scratch.

Text+Image-to-Image (TI2I) ‚Üí Teaches it to edit an image given instructions.

Image-to-Image Reconstruction (I2I) ‚Üí Ensures it can preserve details faithfully when no edits are needed.

The team employed curriculum learning with a progressive training strategy:

This staged approach ensures the model doesn‚Äôt ‚Äúhallucinate‚Äù edits. Instead, it learns when to modify and when to leave things alone.

üé• Again, the Doctor Strange analogy fits: just as Strange masters simple spells before bending entire cityscapes, Qwen-Image progresses from simple edits to complex transformations.

Innovative Positional Encoding: MSRoPE

Qwen-Image introduces Multimodal Scalable RoPE (MSRoPE), a novel positional encoding method that treats text inputs as 2D tensors positioned along the diagonal of the image grid. This design enables resolution scaling advantages while maintaining functional equivalence to 1D-RoPE for text, solving challenges around distinguishing text tokens from image tokens.

State-of-the-Art VAE

The model employs a specially fine-tuned VAE decoder trained on text-rich images, achieving superior reconstruction quality (PSNR: 36.63, SSIM: 0.9839 on text images) compared to existing VAEs like FLUX-VAE and SD-3.5-VAE.


### Precision Without¬†Masks


Here‚Äôs where Qwen-Image really breaks with tradition: it doesn‚Äôt need manual regions of interest. No brushes, no bounding boxes, no fiddling with selections.

Instead, you provide natural language prompts, and the model figures out what to target.

If the result isn‚Äôt perfect on the first try, you refine with chained prompts:

This iterative refinement is like Strange‚Äôs time loop in the movie: repeat, adjust, repeat‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääuntil the outcome is just right.

Real-World Testing: Beyond the Benchmarks

In hands-on testing, Qwen-Image demonstrates remarkable consistency across diverse editing scenarios.

Creating a left profile view from a frontal portrait maintains facial features and lighting with impressive fidelity‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääthe kind of spatial reasoning that often trips up other models.

Localized text replacement works very well, with an impressive ability to recreate special text like movie titles.

Even more striking is its multi-turn text editing capability: starting with a base image, you can iteratively add text elements across multiple prompts while preserving existing content.

Each successive edit builds naturally on the previous state without degrading image quality or introducing artifacts.

This chained editing workflow feels genuinely practical, not just technically impressive.

Limitations and Challenges

Despite its strengths, Qwen-Image has notable limitations in handling complex or obscure elements in a single pass. For instance, in text editing tasks involving rare Chinese characters like ‚ÄòÁ®Ω‚Äô, the model may fail to correct errors accurately on the first try, requiring iterative refinements to achieve the desired result. This highlights a challenge in one-step precision for less common content.

Additionally, users report inconsistencies in visual fidelity, such as unintended changes to facial details during targeted edits like hair color modifications, or reduced image quality when processing high-resolution inputs. In benchmarks, while it excels in semantic consistency (e.g., 8.00 on GEdit-Bench English), perceptual quality scores (7.86) indicate room for improvement in maintaining photorealism without artifacts.‚Äù


### The Prompt¬†Cookbook


Because prompt-driven editing is a new paradigm, it helps to have a few recipes ready. Based on the official documentation and community testing, here are proven prompt patterns:

Text Rendering (Qwen-Image‚Äôs Strength)

English Text:

Mixed Language:

Object and Style Modifications

Precise Object Changes:

Style Transformations:

Advanced Editing¬†Patterns

Chained Editing (Iterative Refinement):

Technical Quality Enhancers: Add to any prompt: ‚Äú, Ultra HD, 4K, cinematic composition‚Äù (English)

Prompt Structure Formula

[Subject] + [Action/Pose] + [Environment] + [Text Specification] + [Style] + [Technical Details]

Example: ‚ÄúA professional businesswoman [subject] presenting confidently [action] in a modern conference room [environment] with a screen displaying ‚ÄòGrowth Report 2025‚Äô [text] in corporate photography style [style], sharp focus, professional lighting [technical]‚Äù

Troubleshooting Common¬†Issues:


### Where Qwen Stands Among¬†Peers


Qwen-Image enters a competitive 2025 landscape where the stakes for high-fidelity image generation and editing have never been higher. Its unique focus on precision and multilingual text gives it a distinct position.

Performance on Public Leaderboards

To objectively measure performance, the community relies on platforms like AI Arena, where thousands of users conduct blind, pairwise comparisons of models. As of August 19, 2025, Qwen-Image‚Äôs performance is a standout success for open-source AI.

On the Image Edit Arena, a leaderboard specifically for instruction-based editing (with 2,395,114 total votes across 9 models), top proprietary models lead with flux-1-kontext-max (ELO: 1184), flux-1-kontext-pro (ELO: 1182), and gpt-image-1 (ELO: 1178). Qwen-Image-Edit ranks 6th overall with an ELO of 1087, making it the highest-placed open-source model on this leaderboard, ahead of other open-weights like bagel (8th, ELO: 1046) and stepix-edit (9th, ELO: 1023)

This is significant‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääit demonstrates that an open-source model can break into a domain previously dominated by closed, corporate-backed systems.

In the Text-to-Image Arena (with 1,002,924 total votes across 19 models), Qwen-Image ranks 8th with an ELO of 1047, positioning it as the only open-weight model in the top 10, surrounded by proprietary leaders like imagen-4.0-ultra-generate-preview-06‚Äì06 (ELO: 1133) and gpt-image-1 (ELO: 1130).

However, real-world gaps persist: community tests note it lags in high-resolution handling, sometimes reducing quality to ‚Äòcartoon-like‚Äô outputs, and seed-dependent inconsistencies where edits work flawlessly in one run but alter unintended areas in another.


### Real-World Applications


Where might this matter?

Designers can adjust posters, packaging, or product visuals without rebuilding layouts. Especially helpful with targeted edits like clothing swaps without artifacts.

Newsrooms can quickly localize infographics in Chinese, English, or bilingual formats. But obscure fonts may need multiple passes

Archivists can restore cultural or historical imagery with fidelity to original styles.

Hobbyists and artists can experiment with stylistic transformations, combining creativity with control, pretty handy with meme generation. Photographic inputs sometimes yield ‚Äòsmooth artificial‚Äô results, limiting realism.

E-commerce platforms can efficiently modify product images for different markets and languages. For product visuals, it‚Äôs best for close-ups‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääfull-body shots or backgrounds can lead to mismatches in lighting or color, requiring refinements


### Technical Implementation Details


Multi-Task Training Framework

For image editing tasks, Qwen-Image extends MSRoPE by introducing a frame dimension to distinguish between input and target images. The model processes both the original image (via VAE encoding) and semantic understanding (via Qwen2.5-VL) simultaneously.

Advanced Data¬†Pipeline

The training leverages a comprehensive 7-stage data filtering pipeline:

Producer-Consumer Framework

For large-scale training efficiency, Qwen-Image employs a Ray-inspired Producer-Consumer architecture that decouples data preprocessing from model training, enabling scalable distributed training across GPU clusters.

When Doctor Strange manipulates time and space, it looks effortless. In reality, it‚Äôs careful, disciplined work that avoids shattering the universe.

Qwen-Image feels much the same. Beneath its prompt-driven simplicity lies dual encoders, multi-task optimization, innovative positional encoding, and a curriculum that teaches restraint as much as creativity. It won‚Äôt replace Photoshop, nor will it make Stable Diffusion obsolete. But it offers a new way forward for precise, context-aware editing.

Think of it as a spell in your creative toolkit‚Ää‚Äî‚Äänot the next big thing, but the right tool when speed and precision count.

By Lakshmi narayana .U on August 21, 2025.

title: Deploying a Large Language Model Locally: A Comprehensive Guide
content:
### Deploying a Large Language Model Locally: A Comprehensive Guide



### Introduction


Understanding the inner workings of a Large Language Model (LLM) can be as fulfilling as nurturing a plant in your backyard. It‚Äôs an engaging endeavor that grants you insight into the mechanics and opportunities offered by machine learning models. Depending on your expertise, there are various approaches to deploy an LLM locally. In this article, we explore these options, guiding you through each step of the process.


### Why Deploy¬†Locally?


Before diving into the ‚Äúhow,‚Äù it‚Äôs essential to address the ‚Äúwhy.‚Äù Deploying an LLM locally allows you to:

1. Integrate seamlessly into the open-source community2. Implement a modular approach for less intensive tasks3. Fine-tune models for specific requirements4. Experiment with different licensing options5. Acquire hands-on experience and in-depth understanding of LLMs


### Options for Local Deployment


Level 1: Getting Started with Hugging¬†Face

Hugging Face offers a plethora of pre-trained LLMs that can be easily downloaded and used for various tasks such as Question & Answer (Q&A), chatbots, and more advanced applications like Retriever-Augmented Generation (RAG).

1. Installation: Use Python libraries and simple lines of code to get started. Installing additional libraries might be necessary.¬†2. Hardware Requirements: Assess the capabilities of your machine. For instance, on an entry-level MacBook Air M1 with 8GB RAM, you may find it challenging to load models over 3GB.

3. Resources to Explore:¬†‚Ää‚Äî‚Ää[Fabio‚Äôs Tutorial on Medium]‚Ää‚Äî‚Ää[AI Anytime Video]

Level 2: Using Integrated Environments‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäLMStudio

If you prefer to keep things simple, LMStudio is a potent solution. This integrated environment reduces complexities and enables you to work with models up to 5GB in size for a 7-billion-parameter model like Zephyr-7b-alpha.Q4_K_M.gguf.

1. Installation: Installing LMStudio is straightforward on a Mac.

2. Model Download: Even easier is downloading the model of your choice.

3. Initial Tests: Run some preliminary chat sessions within LMStudio to ensure the model functions correctly, and take note of metrics like time taken for the first token.

4. HTTP Server: Run an HTTP server to interact with the model outside LMStudio. This approach eliminates the need for API keys, making it easier to reuse existing code.

5. Coding Environment: You can use any Python IDE, like Anaconda Navigator, to run your code. Below is an example code snippet.

6. Repeat the process for a few¬†models

Example Models and Resources

- [Zephyr-7b-alpha.Q4_K_M.gguf Model Card]- [Video Tutorial on Chatbot and LMStudio]- [LM Studio Examples]


### Conclusion: Your Path¬†Forward


Just like Neo from ‚ÄúThe Matrix,‚Äù you too have a choice: ‚ÄúYou take the blue pill‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääthe story ends, you wake up in your bed and believe whatever you want to believe. You take the red pill‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääyou stay in Wonderland, and I show you how deep the rabbit hole goes.‚Äù Venturing into the world of local LLMs offers you endless possibilities‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääfrom fine-tuning to model quantization‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääthat will deepen your understanding and skill set in this ever-evolving field.

Taking the time to experiment and learn with local deployments of LLMs can be a rewarding journey, positioning you well for future advancements in this exciting field. So, are you ready to take the red pill?

title: Rethinking Enterprise AI: The Role of SLMs and Agentic AI
content:
### Rethinking Enterprise AI: The Role of SLMs and Agentic¬†AI


The emergence of DeepSeek, a Chinese AI startup, has sent shockwaves through the global AI industry, challenging the dominance of established tech giants. DeepSeek‚Äôs latest AI model rivals leading U.S. models in performance while being developed at a fraction of the cost. This development has led to significant market reactions, with major tech stocks experiencing substantial declines. Even some of the social reactions are pretty wild. Here is one.

This disruption prompts a reevaluation of AI ownership across the value chain. Organizations must now (rather forced to) consider whether to develop proprietary models, collaborate on open-source platforms, or integrate third-party solutions, balancing factors such as cost, control, and innovation potential. The rise of efficient, open-source models like DeepSeek‚Äôs R1 suggests an urgency of shifting towards more democratized AI development, potentially reshaping strategies in AI adoption and deployment. Further, Deepseek‚Äôs release of distilled models has allowed even tiny laptops to run them (mine included, an 8GB Mac Air).

With the latest Citi GPS report highlighting a 17-fold increase in references to agentic AI in 2024, it is clear that businesses are working toward AI systems capable of autonomous decision-making. DeepSeek‚Äôs emergence could bolster this trend, offering enterprises an alternative to relying solely on large-scale models controlled by a handful. The question of ‚Äòowning AI‚Äô is no longer a binary one‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääorganizations will be compelled to decide whether to build, license, or strategically integrate AI solutions based on efficiency, security, and domain specificity.

This article explores how open-source models like DeepSeek, along with similar advancements, are heralding a trend of accelerating the adoption of SLMs, agentic AI, and specialized enterprise AI architectures, shaping the next frontier of AI-powered innovation.

The AI Landscape in¬†2025

According to Citi‚Äôs latest GPS report (January 2025), references to agentic AI by BigTech companies soared, while 37% of venture capital funding in 2024 flowed into AI startups‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääboth reaching all-time highs. Notably, the financial services sector has emerged as the second-largest adopter of AI, trailing only behind the telecom and media industries.

This rapid evolution is driven by the increasing need for domain-specific, efficient, and secure AI solutions, leading to a shift away from monolithic models toward Small Language Models (SLMs) and AI agents.

Understanding Agentic AI and Small Language¬†Models

The Rise of Agentic AI

Agentic AI represents a fundamental paradigm shift‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääthese systems can autonomously make decisions and execute tasks without constant human intervention. The Citi report underscores that agentic AI could have a greater economic and financial impact than even the rise of the internet.

As Jensen Huang, CEO of NVIDIA, states:

Enterprise AI is no longer limited to passive assistants‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääit is evolving into dynamic, decision-making agents, capable of independently managing complex workflows, mitigating risks, and driving efficiency.

The Strategic Value of Small Language Models¬†(SLMs)

SLMs are transforming enterprise AI implementation through a unique combination of benefits. Experimental results show that specialized models can achieve better performance or greater compression rates than the original large model in various application fields and neural network architectures [Wu et al., 2024].

Technical Advantages:- Reduced computational overhead and infrastructure costs- Faster inference and deployment times- Lower memory requirements enabling edge deployment

Business Benefits:- Enhanced security through controlled, on-premise deployment- Precise governance and compliance control- Better integration with domain-specific knowledge bases- Cost-effective scaling for enterprise-wide adoption

These advantages make SLMs particularly compelling for regulated industries and specialized use cases where traditional LLMs may be impractical or cost-prohibitive.

Arcee AI‚Äôs Implementation in Finance with SLMs and Agent¬†network

The Citi report highlights Arcee AI, a company leveraging SLMs and agentic AI to revolutionize credit memo generation in financial services. Their architecture demonstrates how multiple specialized models collaborate efficiently:

1. Task Decomposition & Routing Agent

2. Domain-Specific AI Models

3. Integration Points

This multi-agent system replaces manual workflows, reducing time-to-decision while ensuring compliance and auditability.

Brief overview of Arcee AI

Arcee AI is a company founded in late 2023 that specializes in developing small language models (SLMs) for enterprise applications. Their flagship product, Arcee Orchestra, leverages SLMs to implement custom agentic AI workflows.

Arcee AI‚Äôs key offerings include

1. A developer platform for pre-training, aligning, and adapting domain-specific SLMs.2. Innovative techniques like Model Merging and Spectrum for efficient SLM training.3. Arcee Cloud, a SaaS interface for easy SLM training and deployment[3].4. A range of SLM models, including Arcee Agent, Arcee Spark, and Arcee Nova, designed for various tasks and parameter sizes.

The company aims to provide more efficient, scalable, and secure AI solutions compared to large language models (LLMs). Arcee AI‚Äôs approach focuses on domain-adapted models that can be securely deployed within a client‚Äôs own virtual private cloud (VPC) environment, catering to industries such as legal, healthcare, finance, and insurance.

Cross-Industry Applications

The adoption of SLMs and agentic AI extend far beyond finance. Several industries are witnessing notable changes:

1. Healthcare

2. Supply Chain & Logistics

3. Insurance

The Future of Enterprise AI

Market Implications

The Citi report predicts that SLMs and agentic AI will redefine how enterprises approach AI, moving from general-purpose AI models toward highly specialized, task-driven AI ecosystems.

The next wave of AI innovation will likely prioritize:

Governance & Security Considerations

SLMs offer critical advantages in:‚úÖ Risk mitigation through controlled deployments‚úÖ Audit-friendly compliance for regulated industries‚úÖ Security-first implementations, reducing LLM-associated risks

As autonomous AI agents become more prevalent, governance will play a crucial role in AI accountability and transparency.

Human-AI Collaboration

The future of AI isn‚Äôt about replacing human expertise‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääit‚Äôs about augmenting decision-making with specialized AI agents, ensuring efficiency, accuracy, and compliance in high-stakes environments.

The emergence of DeepSeek, Small Language Models, and Agentic AI signals an important shift in enterprise AI implementation. Rather than relying on monolithic AI models, companies are building, integrating, and deploying highly specialized AI systems tailored to their unique needs.

By embracing SLMs and AI agents, businesses gain:

The shift from one-size-fits-all LLMs to modular, orchestrated AI ecosystems marks the beginning of a new AI era‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääone where ownership, efficiency, and specialization dictate enterprise AI strategy.

With DeepSeek accelerating this transformation, 2025 may be the year when AI becomes truly industry-specific, accountable, and efficient.


### Thank you for being a part of the community

title: Creating Voice AI Agents Made Easy: Exploring Daily.co‚Äôs DailyBots
content:
### Creating Voice AI Agents Made Easy: Exploring Daily.co‚Äôs DailyBots


Ever wondered how to create your own AI voice agent without getting lost in technical complexity? Daily.co‚Äôs latest innovation, DailyBots, is making this easier than ever. While AI and voice technology might sound intimidating, Daily.co has developed a platform that simplifies the entire process, making it accessible for developers at all skill levels.

Leading AI Agent Innovations

A couple of days ago, NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang‚Äôs CES keynote video went viral. You can check out my capture below (courtesy of Grok).

In the keynote, he showcased several companies across various segments, including those involved in the orchestration and management layer for agents.

I covered most of them (CrewAI, Llamaindex, Langchain and Weights & Biases) in my articles, and here are a few links.

I missed out on Daily.io. This article provides a brief exploration of its products and solutions, with a special focus on audio bots. I will cover the video offerings in depth in my later articles.

About Daily.co

Daily.co is a platform that offers real-time voice, video, and AI solutions for developers. Here are some key applications and features you can use it for:

Real-time CommunicationDaily.co provides infrastructure for building and hosting real-time voice and video calls. This can be used for:

- Video conferencing applications- Telehealth platforms- Remote collaboration tools- Customer support systems

AI IntegrationThe platform offers tools for integrating AI into communication applications:

- Pipecat: An open-source orchestration framework for creating real-time voice and multimodal AI agents.- Daily Bots: A cloud offering that allows deployment of AI agents built with open-source SDKs.

Developer ToolsDaily.co provides resources for developers to build and scale communication applications:

- WebRTC-native SDKs: For implementing high-quality video and audio functionality.- Global infrastructure: Offering low latency and high reliability for worldwide deployment.

Enterprise SolutionsFor businesses, Daily.co offers:

- Enterprise-grade security: Including end-to-end encryption and HIPAA compliance.- Scalability: With a global mesh network supporting large-scale deployments- Customization: Ability to build tailored communication solutions[1].

Open Source ContributionsAs a W3C WebRTC Working Group member, Daily.co contributes to open-source projects, which can be beneficial for developers looking to leverage and contribute to community-driven technologies.

With these features, Daily.co can be used to create a wide range of communication and AI-powered applications, from simple video chat integrations to complex, AI-driven interaction platforms.

Let‚Äôs explore the implementation of its daily bots using the demo code available on GitHub.

About Daily¬†bots

Daily Bots is a platform that allows developers to quickly create voice and video agents that can be integrated into applications. It is built using open-source SDKs and is deployed on Daily‚Äôs real-time global infrastructure.

Daily Bots is designed to handle the complexities of voice AI product development. It allows developers to leverage these features with just a few lines of code and track the metrics via an in-depth dashboard.

About Daily.co¬†Video

As we‚Äôve seen, Daily.co has successfully simplified the process of creating voice AI agents through DailyBots. title: Exploring GPT-4.1: New Capabilities for AI Applications
content:
### Exploring GPT-4.1: New Capabilities for AI Applications


The GPT-4.1 Advantage: Coding, Instructions, and Million-Token Context

OpenAI unveiled its GPT-4.1 family of models. This release introduces three variants: GPT-4.1, GPT-4.1 Mini, and the efficient GPT-4.1 Nano. Unlike incremental updates, this release represents a step forward, outperforming its predecessors across multiple dimensions while focusing on real-world utility.

GPT-4.1 shows solid improvement across three areas: coding capabilities, instruction following, and long-context processing. The model family comes with a refreshed knowledge cutoff of June 2024, providing more current information than previous iterations.

Performance metrics show GPT-4.1 Mini matching or exceeding GPT-4o‚Äôs intelligence while reducing latency by nearly half and costs by 83%. GPT-4.1 Nano, the company‚Äôs fastest and cheapest model, delivers good performance for its size and speed.

This launch also marks the beginning of the end for GPT-4.5 Preview. OpenAI has announced a three-month deprecation timeline, citing both the better performance-to-cost ratio of GPT-4.1 and the need to reclaim GPU resources for future research initiatives.


### Coding Betterments


GPT-4.1‚Äôs coding capabilities represent a notable advance. On SWE-bench Verified, an evaluation of real-world software engineering skills, GPT-4.1 achieves a 54.6% completion rate compared to GPT-4o‚Äôs 33.2%. This benchmark tests a model‚Äôs ability to navigate codebases, implement solutions, and produce functional code that passes tests.

On Aider‚Äôs polyglot benchmark, GPT-4.1 doubles GPT-4o‚Äôs performance on code diff generation. Internal evaluations show that extraneous edits on code dropped from 9% with GPT-4o to 2% with GPT-4.1, reducing the need for error correction.

Frontend development shows clear improvements. When generating UIs and web applications, GPT-4.1 creates more functional interfaces. In comparisons using the same prompts, human evaluators preferred GPT-4.1‚Äôs websites over GPT-4o‚Äôs 80% of the time.

Case Study: ‚ÄúCineCards‚Äù- A single page react application

To develop this cinema flashcard web application for film students and movie enthusiasts, I utilized the same prompt in Windsurf and OpenAI Playground, comparing their outputs. Both platforms effectively met the prompt‚Äôs requirements. However, Windsurf unexpectedly ceased functioning as an agent, requiring reminders to resume agent-like behavior for edits, and it performed noticeably slower.

Full code available in the github link here.


### Enhanced Instruction Following


A key improvement in GPT-4.1 is its instruction following capability. Developers have often struggled with getting models to adhere to specified formats, negative instructions, ordered steps, and content requirements. GPT-4.1 addresses these challenges.

OpenAI‚Äôs internal instruction following evaluation tests six dimensions: format following, negative instructions, ordered instructions, content requirements, ranking, and handling uncertainty. On challenging instruction sets, GPT-4.1 achieves 49% accuracy compared to GPT-4o‚Äôs 29%.

Multi-turn coherence‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääremembering and applying instructions from earlier in a conversation‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääshows similar improvement. On the MultiChallenge benchmark, GPT-4.1 scores 38.3% versus GPT-4o‚Äôs 27.8%, demonstrating better ability to maintain context throughout extended interactions.

Format adherence, a challenge for developers building structured applications, improves with GPT-4.1 scoring 87.4% on IFEval compared to GPT-4o‚Äôs 81.0%. This benchmark evaluates a model‚Äôs ability to follow verifiable instructions, such as maintaining specific content length or avoiding certain terms.

These improvements have practical impact, as seen with Blue J, a tax advisory platform. They reported GPT-4.1 was 53% more accurate than GPT-4o on challenging tax scenarios. Similarly, Hex found GPT-4.1 delivered nearly twice the performance on their SQL evaluation set, particularly in correctly selecting tables from large schemas.


### Long Context Understanding


A major technical advancement in GPT-4.1 is its expanded context window. All three models‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääeven the lightweight Nano‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääcan process up to 1 million tokens of context, an increase from the 128,000 token limit of previous GPT-4o models. For perspective, 1 million tokens represents more than eight complete copies of the entire React codebase.

GPT-4.1 demonstrates consistent accuracy in retrieving information regardless of position within the context window. In ‚Äúneedle-in-haystack‚Äù evaluations, GPT-4.1 achieves consistent performance across all positions in documents up to the full 1 million token length, ensuring that information isn‚Äôt lost even when buried deep in large documents.

For tasks requiring multi-hop reasoning across documents, the Graphwalks benchmark represents a challenging test. It requires models to perform a breadth-first search through a directed graph of hexadecimal hashes filling the context window. GPT-4.1 achieves 61.7% accuracy on this benchmark, outperforming GPT-4o‚Äôs 41.7%.

Case Study: Querying Mahabharata and VyƒÅdha¬†Gƒ´tƒÅ

To check out GPT-4.1 long context based capabilities, I uploaded an abridged Mahabharata text file and tested queries across its content. The results were satisfactory and compared well to Gemini 2.5 Pro.

Notably, for the same query from VyƒÅdha Gƒ´tƒÅ, pasting the entire file into the context window produced better responses than uploading the file.


### Improved Vision Capabilities


The GPT-4.1 series shines in image comprehension, with GPT-4.1 mini achieving a remarkable breakthrough, often outperforming GPT-4o on image-based benchmarks.

Additionally, when OpenAI researchers shared a 30‚Äì60-minute video without subtitles and tested the model with multiple-choice questions, GPT-4.1 demonstrated superior understanding and accuracy in its responses.

Case Study: Querying a Silent Charlie Chaplin Short¬†Film

I analyzed the 1915 short film The Tramp to test vision capabilities, using multiple-choice questions generated by Gemini 2.5 Pro. I compared ‚Äògpt-4.1-nano-2025‚Äì04‚Äì14‚Äô and ‚Äògpt-4o‚Äô, finding that ‚Äògpt-4.1-nano‚Äô outperformed ‚Äògpt-4o‚Äô.

Code and outputs are available at this GitHub link.


### Building with GPT-4.1: The Art of Effective Prompting


To leverage GPT-4.1‚Äôs capabilities, OpenAI recommends developers understand optimal prompting strategies. Three elements have proven effective for agentic workflows: persistence prompts that ensure the model continues until a task is complete; tool-calling prompts that encourage appropriate use of available tools; and planning prompts that induce step-by-step reasoning.

While GPT-4.1 is not a dedicated reasoning model, developers can induce explicit reasoning through chain-of-thought techniques. By instructing the model to ‚Äúthink step by step‚Äù and break down complex problems, GPT-4.1 can perform reasoning tasks with improved accuracy. In agentic settings, this approach has shown to increase success rates by approximately 4% on challenging benchmarks.

Context organization affects performance. For long-context applications, placing instructions at both the beginning and end of the provided context produces better results than single placement. A structure that includes role definition, clear instructions, reasoning steps, output format guidance, and examples provides consistent performance.

The choice of delimiters for structuring prompts can also impact model behavior. Markdown headings work well for organizing sections, while XML tags perform well for nesting and wrapping content. For document collections in long context, XML with document IDs and titles has proven effective, while JSON formats have shown poorer performance.


### The Road Ahead: Practical Applications and Future Potential


GPT-4.1‚Äôs advancements come with economic benefits. Through improved inference systems, OpenAI offers the model at prices 26% lower than GPT-4o for median queries. GPT-4.1 Nano, at 12 cents per million tokens (blended rate), represents the company‚Äôs most affordable option. Additionally, long context requests carry no premium beyond standard per-token costs.

For production deployments, developers can leverage additional cost optimizations. The Batch API provides an additional 50% discount for non-time-sensitive processing, while prompt caching now offers a 75% discount for queries that repeatedly use the same context‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääuseful for applications that analyze the same documents repeatedly with different queries.

The improvements in instruction following and long context comprehension make GPT-4.1 valuable for powering autonomous agents. When combined with tools like the Responses API, developers can build systems that accomplish complex tasks with less supervision‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääfrom software engineering to document analysis and customer support.

Looking forward, GPT-4.1‚Äôs capabilities are extensible through fine-tuning. Both GPT-4.1 and GPT-4.1 Mini are available for fine-tuning immediately, with Nano scheduled to join the lineup in the near future. This customization pathway allows organizations to adapt these models to specific domains while maintaining the core improvements in instruction following and context processing.

The release of GPT-4.1 represents a step forward in practical AI application. By focusing on developer needs across coding, instruction following, and long context understanding, these models create new possibilities for AI-powered systems.


### Thank you for being a part of the community

title: Exploring AI and Author Contributions in Article Generation
content:
### Exploring AI and Author Contributions in Article Generation


Viewing AI as an assistant rather than a co-author allows us to appreciate its efficiency while emphasizing the irreplaceable nature of human creativity in content creation.


### Is it AI or¬†myself?


The use of AI in article generation has raised some interesting questions about authorship and contribution. When AI is used to write an article, it can sometimes leave us questioning whether we wrote something or if it was the AI.

This confusion can be clarified by understanding the process of writing and how it translates into the AI context. In the traditional writing process, we brainstorm ideas, create an outline, write a draft, revise, and then edit our work. While using AI, this process undergoes slight modifications. The brainstorming process might involve feeding the AI with context documents or prompts. The AI then generates a draft based on the input. The user then revises and edits this draft, often having to rephrase or reorder the AI‚Äôs suggestions to meet their specific needs.

The AI can indeed generate a coherent and structured draft, but it‚Äôs the human touch that refines this draft into a final piece. This human involvement in the process is what makes us the authors of the AI-generated text. Even though the AI contributes significantly to the initial draft, it lacks the ability to understand nuances, cultural contexts, and most importantly, the unique perspective of the human author.

In some cases, AI can be seen as a tool, similar to a pen or a typewriter. Just as we don‚Äôt credit pens for the text they help us write, we don‚Äôt credit AI for the articles it helps us generate. The AI is merely a tool that helps us get our ideas out there, but it‚Äôs our ideas and perspectives that make the piece unique and worth reading.

However, this doesn‚Äôt downplay the importance of AI in the process. AI significantly reduces the time and effort required to generate the initial draft. It can even help overcome writer‚Äôs block by providing prompts and suggestions. But at the end of the day, it‚Äôs the human author who shapes these suggestions into a final piece that reflects their unique perspective.

This perspective provides a framework for understanding author contributions in AI-generated articles. We can view AI as an assistant that aids the writing process rather than a co-author. This way, we can appreciate the efficiency of AI while maintaining the importance of human creativity and thought in content creation.


### Using Obsidian, Smart Connections Plugin, and ChatGPT-4 to Write Professional Articles


The combination of Obsidian, the Smart Connections plugin, and ChatGPT-4 is a powerful trio for professional article writing. Here is how I utilize these tools in my workflow:

First, I start by jotting down a brief note in Obsidian about my topic. For example (link to the article above), I might write about the influence of a particular Sanskrit verse on my life, shared by my college instructor. Obsidian‚Äôs non-linear note-taking system allows me to organize my thoughts effectively and link my ideas in an intricate web of knowledge.

Next, I use the Smart Connections plugin within Obsidian. This plugin identifies related notes in my Obsidian vault, allowing me to draw connections between different ideas or topics. For instance, it might link my note about the Sanskrit verse to other notes about Sanskrit literature, my college experiences, or the philosophy behind the verse.

Having created this network of ideas, I then turn to ChatGPT-4 to draft my article. I input my notes into the AI model, and it generates an initial draft based on the context I‚Äôve provided. The model‚Äôs vast context window enables it to handle large blocks of text, making it an excellent tool for processing the interconnected thoughts I‚Äôve mapped out in Obsidian.

Finally, I refine and polish the draft, ensuring it has the right tone and structure. This step often involves rephrasing or reordering the AI‚Äôs suggestions to better suit my needs. The final result is a well-structured, high-quality article that reflects my unique perspective on the topic.

Through this process, the AI serves as a valuable assistant, helping me to overcome writer‚Äôs block and streamline my workflow. However, it‚Äôs important to remember that the AI is just a tool. The final article is a result of my ideas, my creativity, and my unique perspective, shaped with the assistance of AI.


### So, considering the above example, can we measure the contributions of both the AI and the¬†author?


Here‚Äôs a simplified attempt which could be further refined. While this approach may not be perfect, it provides two significant insights: firstly, it suggests a self-assessment method for authors, and secondly, it sparks ideas for AI engineers to develop a tool or a GPT model that facilitates this process. In fact, platforms like Medium could potentially incorporate this feature. (As you can see below, it is more of self-assessment and doesn‚Äôt ratify anything from a copyright standpoint.)

Updated Guide for Estimating Author and AI Contribution Percentages Based on Article¬†Text

Sample Prompt¬†Template

I created several adaptable versions based on the above, allowing for customizable weight inputs. This approach enables modification to meet individual needs until an official, more refined version, akin to a self-disciplined classifier, is developed.
