title: Not Just AI Updates: What Microsoft Build and Google I/O 2025 Quietly Told Us About the Future of‚Ä¶
content:
### Not Just AI Updates: What Microsoft Build and Google I/O 2025 Quietly Told Us About the Future of¬†Tech


The Conferences Were Loud, But What Was Whispered?Microsoft Build and Google I/O delivered everything you‚Äôd expect: dazzling demos, smarter assistants, upgraded tools. But beneath the AI fireworks and product pageantry, there were quieter indicators; signals that point to a deeper transformation in how we build, interact with, and even think about technology.

For those unfamiliar: Microsoft Build is the company‚Äôs annual developer conference where it unveils the latest updates to its software tools and platforms. Google I/O serves a similar purpose, focusing on Android, AI, and emerging consumer technologies.

The Age of Agentic Computing Is HereMicrosoft introduced a vision for an ‚Äúopen agentic web‚Äù enabled by interoperable AI agents. Copilot Studio now allows creation of autonomous AI agents that use multimodal inputs‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääimages, mockups, and text‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääto complete tasks like feature addition or code refactoring. Project Astra from Google envisions proactive AI that can act before being prompted, anticipating needs and responding in real time.

GitHub Copilot has entered ‚Äúpeer programmer‚Äù territory, integrating with GitHub Issues and Visual Studio Code to handle bug fixes, write docs, and auto-generate pull requests. Agent Mode now connects external tools and datasets using the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

On-Device AI Is the Real Power MoveMicrosoft‚Äôs Edge browser now supports on-device AI using Phi-4 Mini (in the Canary and dev channels), offering editing, translation, and summarization with local processing for privacy and speed. This aligns with Google‚Äôs Gemini Flash, which brings cost-efficient multimodal reasoning directly to Android.

Both companies stress performance and privacy: latency-free experiences, local inference, and reduced cloud dependency signal a fundamental shift in AI architecture.

UX Is Getting Rewritten‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäNot Just RedesignedGoogle‚Äôs Stitch and Canvas empower designers to create interfaces from natural language or visual cues. Android 16, showcased at The Android Show, supports Material 3 Expressive‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääa design language that unifies UI across platforms.

Microsoft‚Äôs low-code Copilot Tuning in Microsoft 365 allows organizations to train Copilot on proprietary workflows. Team Copilot expands collaborative functionality, streamlining meeting prep and follow-ups.

Data Is Getting Granular and Personal‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääand That‚Äôs a Double-Edged SwordMicrosoft Discovery automates scientific workflows, from hypothesis generation to simulation, with early results in sustainability and drug discovery. Google‚Äôs Imagen 4, Lyria 2, and Veo 3 allow users to co-create visuals, music, and videos. Virtual try-ons and AI-generated shopping reports integrate AI deeply into user identity.

But all this raises ethical flags: who controls the AI‚Äôs memory of your behavior? Personalized AI experiences depend on massive data ingestion‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääpushing boundaries around consent, storage, and algorithmic influence.

Search and Coding Will No Longer Be Solo ActivitiesGoogle‚Äôs AI Mode for Search introduces a conversational UI with charting, shopping, and contextual recommendations. Deep Research supports structured investigations. Microsoft is integrating ‚Äúchat with data‚Äù capabilities across Azure and Windows AI Foundry, enabling natural-language access to enterprise datasets‚Ää‚Äî‚Äälike during the NFL Combine demo.

Coding has also changed: Copilot now supports multitasking, auto-test generation, and legacy code explanations.

The Silent Battle: Who Will Own the Developer‚Äôs Mind?

Microsoft‚Äôs Azure AI Foundry and GitHub Copilot battle Google‚Äôs Gemini API, Firebase, and Vertex AI. Microsoft added Grok 3 and Grok 3 Mini to Azure with SLA-backed support. Google added thought summaries, thinking budgets, and MCI compatibility to Gemini 2.5 Pro.

Microsoft also unveiled NLWeb, a framework for embedding chat interfaces on the web using minimal code. MCP support now spans GitHub, Edge, and Windows 11. Google responded with Flow‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääa filmmaking platform combining Veo, Imagen, and Gemini for cinematic content generation.

The Real Takeaway‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäIt‚Äôs Not Just the Tech, It‚Äôs the TempoStitch went public in under six months. Copilot Studio evolved from suggestion engine to full agentic builder in less than a year. Microsoft‚Äôs weather AI model, Aurora, promises 5,000x faster predictions. Google‚Äôs Ironwood TPU delivers 42.5 exaflops per pod.

Speed defines this era. AI isn‚Äôt just smart‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääit‚Äôs fast. And whoever deploys faster gains the upper hand.

Conclusion‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäThe Invisible Interfaces Are the Real RevolutionThe most powerful AI tools will be the ones you barely notice: ambient, embedded, always on. Think AI in Chrome highlighting confusing legal jargon or Microsoft 365 Copilot handling meeting notes seamlessly.

So don‚Äôt just follow the keynotes and feature lists. Watch how your workflow, your devices, your expectations subtly start to change.

Because that‚Äôs where the real future is being built‚Ää‚Äî‚Äänot in the spotlight, but in the shadows.

title: STORM: Stanford‚Äôs Revolutionary Research Tool Harnessing the Power of Agents and Agentic Workflows
content:
### STORM: Stanford‚Äôs Revolutionary Research Tool Harnessing the Power of Agents and Agentic Workflows


In the rapidly evolving field of artificial intelligence, Stanford University has unveiled a groundbreaking project that promises to revolutionize the way we conduct research, synthesize information, and create well-structured content. STORM, which stands for Synthesis of Topic Outlines through Retrieval and Multiperspective question asking, is being hailed as one of the most effective AI research and writing tools to date.

What is¬†STORM?

STORM is an open-source AI system designed to create comprehensive, Wikipedia-style pages on any given topic. What sets STORM apart from other AI tools is its ability to not only compile information but also to reference the sources it uses, providing a level of transparency and credibility that is crucial in today‚Äôs information landscape.

STORM is an agentic system that assists in generating topic outlines for writing Wikipedia-like articles. It aims to automate the pre-writing stage by leveraging large language models (LLMs) and simulating conversations between writers and topic experts. This approach enhances the pre-writing stage, resulting in well-structured and comprehensive articles that rival those found on Wikipedia.

Key Features:

Understanding Agentic¬†Systems

To fully appreciate STORM‚Äôs capabilities, it‚Äôs important to understand the concept of agentic systems, which forms the foundation of STORM‚Äôs functionality.

Agentic Systems and Workflows

Agentic systems are AI-powered frameworks designed to perform tasks with a degree of autonomy and intelligence reminiscent of human agents. These systems are characterized by their ability to:

Agentic workflows refer to the series of steps or processes that these systems follow to complete tasks. In the case of STORM, the agentic workflow includes the retrieval of information, multi-perspective question asking, and synthesis of content.

AI agents are the individual components or entities within an agentic system that perform specific tasks. In STORM, multiple AI agents work together to create a comprehensive research and writing tool. These agents may include:

The use of multiple agents allows STORM to approach tasks from various angles, much like a team of human researchers and writers would collaborate on a complex project.

STORM as an Agentic¬†System

STORM leverages the power of agentic systems to automate and enhance the research and writing process. By employing multiple AI agents in a coordinated workflow, STORM can:

This agentic approach enables STORM to produce comprehensive, well-structured content that rivals human-written articles in breadth and depth.

How STORM¬†Works

The STORM process can be broken down into three main steps: retrieval, multi-perspective question asking, and synthesis.

For instance, when asked about Karma Yoga, STORM produced a comprehensive wiki covering various aspects such as indian spiritual texts, historical context, etymology, practices and techniques, and others.

Benefits of STORM‚Äôs¬†Approach

STORM‚Äôs approach to content creation offers several key benefits:

Accessing STORM

Currently the easiest way to access is at https://storm.genie.stanford.edu/

Just select ‚ÄòNew Session‚Äô and enter the topic to get started.

Check out the brainstorming Process

Generated articles, with TOC and Floating References are saved in ‚ÄòMy Library‚Äô

Setting Up¬†STORM

For those interested in deploying STORM, the setup process involves several steps:

STORM requires two API keys to function:

Users can run STORM either through a command-line interface or via a user-friendly Streamlit-based UI.

Detailed instructions are avaiable at the STORM github page.

Option 2: Using Google Colab

This provides an opportunity to examine some of the code and understand the workings of STORM.

Using OpenAI

1. Setting up the Environment:First, we need to install the required packages. The `knowledge-storm` package is essential for using STORM:

2. Importing Required Libraries:After installation, we import the necessary modules:

3. Setting up API Keys and Configurations:

6. Running STORM:Finally, we run STORM to generate an article on a given topic:

Using Claude AI

1. Installing Required Packages:

2. Importing Required Libraries:We import the required modules, including Claude-specific ones:

3. Setting up Environment Variables:

4. Configuring STORM with Claude Models:We set up STORM to use various Claude models for different components:

The above demonstrate different ways to set up and run STORM, one using OpenAI‚Äôs GPT models and another using Anthropic‚Äôs Claude models. Both approaches follow the same general structure but differ in the specific models and configurations used.

Output from each is a set of 9 files as under.

In addition to the above, STORM can access personal datasets using Qdrant but I was unable to get it working.

Here are the two files from above in my github repository that utilize the build on examples in STORM Github and a sample set of output files.

Flexibility and Future Development

One of STORM‚Äôs strengths is its flexibility. While it can utilize OpenAI‚Äôs powerful language models, it‚Äôs not dependent on them. Local setup options are available using VLM with Mistral, and Ollama integration for local models is round the corner.

The project has gained significant traction in the developer community, amassing nearly 62,000 stars on GitHub shortly after its release. This popularity is likely to drive further improvements and expansions of STORM‚Äôs capabilities.

As STORM continues to evolve, its developers are working on exciting new features. One such feature in the pipeline is a ‚Äúhuman-AI collaboration mode,‚Äù which promises to further enhance the tool‚Äôs utility and user interaction. This could potentially allow for even more nuanced and tailored content creation, combining the strengths of AI with human insight and creativity.

STORM represents an important step forward in AI-assisted agentic research, content creation, and writing. By combining the power of multiple AI agents, comprehensive web scraping, coherent content synthesis, and innovative features like multi-perspective question asking, all while maintaining source transparency, STORM has the potential to become an dependable tool for researchers, writers, and knowledge seekers across various fields.

The system‚Äôs ability to automate the pre-writing stage, discover diverse perspectives, and create well-structured outlines addresses many of the challenges faced in producing high-quality, comprehensive content. As the project continues to develop and improve, it may well redefine how we approach information gathering, synthesis, and content creation in the digital age, setting new standards for AI-assisted writing and research tools.

title: AI and Robotics: Future Gazing with ‚ÄòBlade Runner 2049‚Äô, Popcorn Optional!
content:
### AI and Robotics: Future Gazing with ‚ÄòBlade Runner 2049‚Äô, Popcorn Optional!


Movies often inspire us when we‚Äôre choosing our career paths. I know several people from my college days who dreamed of living in the USA after watching a certain movie or hearing a song. I‚Äôm a big movie fan myself, and my project, MoviSvami GPT, is proof of that.

In an interview, the co-founder of Perplexity.ai (Aravind Srinivas) said that the movie ‚ÄòThe Pirates of Silicon Valley‚Äô inspired him to become an entrepreneur.

Watching movies now and then can be more than mere entertainment; it can inspire us with portrayals of futuristic technology and fuel our excitement for the work we‚Äôre doing now. So, prepare your popcorn, relax, and join us on a cinematic journey into the future of AI and Robotics, through the lens of ‚ÄòBlade Runner 2049‚Äô. And don‚Äôt worry, there‚Äôs no need to check if your popcorn is artificially intelligent!

The Future of AI and Robotics as Depicted in ‚ÄòBlade Runner 2049‚Äô

Science fiction movies often give us a glimpse of possible future technologies. They can be more illustrative than books because they visually represent ideas, making them easier to understand. Some filmmakers even claim that the gadgets in their movies are real or somewhat functional. From classic movies like ‚ÄúChitty Chitty Bang Bang‚Äù to the latest superhero films, they all have interesting tech. So, could these science fiction movies hint at what‚Äôs achievable in the fields of AI and Robotics?

What about the movie ‚ÄòBlade Runner 2049‚Äô? Could it give us some clues? ‚ÄòBlade Runner 2049‚Äô, the sequel to the iconic sci-fi movie ‚ÄòBlade Runner‚Äô, indeed offers a compelling vision of the future where AI and Robotics have become an integral part of human society. The movie showcases advanced AI in the form of ‚ÄòReplicants‚Äô, which are bioengineered humans designed to serve in the off-world colonies. These Replicants demonstrate highly sophisticated cognitive functions and even emotions, highlighting a future where AI could potentially mimic human behavior to a great extent.

Furthermore, the movie presents autonomous flying cars, holographic AI companions, and massive data farms, reflecting on the possibilities of advancements in transportation, virtual reality, and big data. These technologies might seem far-fetched today but considering the rapid pace of advancements in AI and Robotics, they might become a reality sooner than we think.

Here‚Äôs a list of some notable technologies and devices featured in the¬†movie:

1. Synthetic Farming: The opening scenes introduce vast fields of synthetic farming, which are essential for feeding the population in the dystopian world.

2. Flying Cars (Spinners): An evolution from the original Blade Runner, these vehicles are used for both terrestrial and aerial travel, showing advancements in anti-gravity and propulsion technology.

3. Holographic Companions: The film features Joi, a holographic AI companion that demonstrates advanced AI and holographic projection capabilities, offering emotional and social interaction.

4. Voice Command and AI Integration: Buildings and rooms equipped with AI that respond to voice commands for various tasks, showing an integrated smart environment.

5. Biometric Data Analysis: The use of sophisticated devices to analyze DNA and other biometric data for identification and investigation purposes.

6. Memory Creation and Implantation: A significant plot point revolves around the creation of artificial memories and their implantation into replicants, showing advanced neural technology.

7. Advanced Robotics and Replicants: The next generation of replicants shown in the film are more advanced, with some having the ability to disobey orders, reflecting advancements in artificial intelligence and robotics.

8. Environmental Control Technologies: The depiction of a world with massive sea walls to protect against rising sea levels and controlled weather systems indicates advanced environmental technologies.

9. 3D Holographic Displays: Used in various applications throughout the film, from advertising to communication devices, showing advancements in display technology.

10. Remote Drone Surveillance: Used by the main character for reconnaissance, reflecting advancements in drone technology and remote surveillance.

These elements from ‚ÄúBlade Runner 2049‚Äù are not just speculative fiction but also serve as inspiration for real-world technological advancements, exploring themes of artificial intelligence, environmental degradation, and the nature of humanity.

But before we dive in, remember, if your toaster starts asking existential questions, it might be time to unplug it.

How close are we to making this technology a¬†reality?

For each of the futuristic technologies featured in ‚ÄúBlade Runner 2049,‚Äù there are foundational or supporting technologies that exist today at a high level but need further development to achieve the depicted levels of advancement. Here‚Äôs an overview of these base technologies and what advancements are needed:

1. Synthetic Farming:

- Base Technologies: Hydroponics, aeroponics, genetic engineering.

- Needed Advancements: Scalability, energy efficiency, and nutrient optimization to support global food supply sustainably.

2. Flying Cars (Spinners):

- Base Technologies: Electric propulsion, battery technology, autonomous navigation systems.

- Needed Advancements More efficient and longer-lasting battery technologies, advanced air traffic management systems, and robust safety protocols.

3. Holographic Companions:

- Base Technologies: Augmented reality (AR), virtual reality (VR), holographic projection, artificial intelligence.

- Needed Advancements: High-resolution, low-energy-consuming holographic displays, advanced natural language processing, and emotional intelligence in AI.

4. Voice Command and AI Integration:

- Base Technologies: Natural language processing (NLP), machine learning, Internet of Things (IoT).

- Needed Advancements: Improved contextual understanding and predictive analytics in AI, enhanced privacy and security measures for IoT devices.

5. Biometric Data Analysis:

- Base Technologies: Genomics, bioinformatics, machine learning.

- Needed Advancements: Faster, cheaper, and more accurate DNA sequencing methods, advanced algorithms for genetic data interpretation, ethical frameworks for genetic privacy.

6. Memory Creation and Implantation:

- Base Technologies: Neuroscience, brain-computer interfaces (BCIs), neuroimaging.

- Needed Advancements: Detailed understanding of memory storage and retrieval processes, safe and precise methods for memory manipulation or implantation, ethical standards for memory technologies.

7. Advanced Robotics and Replicants:

- Base Technologies: Robotics, artificial intelligence, materials science.

- Needed Advancements: Advanced AI with emotional intelligence and decision-making capabilities, biocompatible materials for lifelike robots, energy-efficient power sources.

8. Environmental Control Technologies:

- Base Technologies: Civil engineering, climate modeling, renewable energy.

- Needed Advancements: Large-scale geoengineering methods, advanced climate prediction models, sustainable and scalable renewable energy solutions.

9. 3D Holographic Displays:

- Base Technologies: Holography, light-field display technology, 3D rendering software.

- Needed Advancements: Wider viewing angles, higher resolution, and interactive capabilities without the need for special glasses or headsets.

10. Remote Drone Surveillance:

- Base Technologies: Drones, autonomous navigation systems, computer vision.

- Needed Advancements: Advanced AI for autonomous decision-making, enhanced battery life or alternative power sources, improved privacy regulations and ethical guidelines.

Achieving the futuristic visions depicted in ‚ÄúBlade Runner 2049‚Äù will require not just technological advancements but also addressing ethical, regulatory, and societal challenges associated with these technologies.

The Role of AI in Realizing the Futuristic Technologies of ‚ÄòBlade Runner¬†2049‚Äô

1. Synthetic Farming:

- AI Role: Optimizing crop yields, monitoring plant health, and automating care.

- Sub-skills/Sub-areas: Machine learning for pattern recognition (e.g., disease detection), predictive analytics for yield optimization, robotics for automated planting and harvesting.

2. Flying Cars (Spinners):

- AI Role: Navigating safely in three-dimensional space, traffic management, autonomous piloting.

- Sub-skills/Sub-areas: Computer vision for obstacle detection and avoidance, reinforcement learning for dynamic path optimization, AI-based traffic management systems for coordinating vehicles.

3. Holographic Companions:

- AI Role: Facilitating natural interaction, personalization, emotional intelligence.

- Sub-skills/Sub-areas: Natural language processing for understanding and generating human-like dialogue, affective computing to recognize and respond to human emotions, machine learning for personalization.

4. Voice Command and AI Integration:

- AI Role: Understanding and executing complex voice commands, integrating with various devices and systems.

- Sub-skills/Sub-areas: Advanced natural language understanding (NLU) for context-aware voice commands, speech recognition, IoT device control through AI decision-making processes.

5. Biometric Data Analysis:

- AI Role: Analyzing genetic information, predicting health outcomes, personalizing medicine.

- Sub-skills/Sub-areas: Bioinformatics for DNA sequence analysis, deep learning for identifying genetic markers related to diseases, AI-driven predictive models for personalized treatment plans.

6. Memory Creation and Implantation:

- AI Role: Modeling and simulating human memory processes, designing interfaces for interaction with neural circuits.

- Sub-skills/Sub-areas: Computational neuroscience for understanding memory storage and retrieval, development of algorithms for encoding and decoding memories, brain-computer interface technology for precise interactions with neural tissue.

7. Advanced Robotics and Replicants:

- AI Role: Enabling autonomous decision-making, social interaction, and complex task execution.

- Sub-skills/Sub-areas: Robotics AI for motion planning and control, machine learning for social cues recognition and interaction, decision-making algorithms for ethical and moral reasoning.

8. Environmental Control Technologies:

- AI Role: Modeling and predicting environmental changes, optimizing large-scale engineering projects.

- Sub-skills/Sub-areas: Climate modeling using AI for accurate predictions, optimization algorithms for resource allocation in environmental projects, machine learning for analyzing and mitigating environmental risks.

9. 3D Holographic Displays:

- AI Role: Creating realistic and interactive 3D content, enhancing user interaction.

- Sub-skills/Sub-areas: 3D rendering algorithms powered by AI, computer vision for interactive displays that respond to user movements, machine learning for improving display technologies over time.

10. Remote Drone Surveillance:

- AI Role: Autonomously navigating and making decisions based on surveillance data.

- Sub-skills/Sub-areas: Autonomous navigation using computer vision, deep learning for real-time object recognition and tracking, decision-making algorithms for surveillance objectives.

In each case, the integration of AI not only enhances the functionality and effectiveness of the technology but also introduces complexities related to ethics, privacy, and the need for robust, transparent, and fair AI systems. This underscores the importance of interdisciplinary research and collaboration in the development of future technologies, where AI plays a central role.

Here‚Äôs a simplified table that groups important companies under each future-focused area:

However, ‚ÄòBlade Runner 2049‚Äô also raises essential ethical questions about the use of AI and Robotics. As we make strides in these fields, it is crucial to consider the moral implications and strive for a future where technology is used responsibly and ethically. Indeed, even though these futuristic technologies seem far away, there is hope that they will materialize someday. If the germs of the future are present today, we also need to be aware of larger issues like the digital divide and ethics. As emphasized by AI experts like Kai-Fu Lee, we must ensure that advancements in AI and Robotics contribute to a future that is inclusive, fair, and beneficial for all.

‚ÄòBlade Runner 2049‚Äô ignites the imagination about the future of AI and Robotics. However, the actual future will be dictated by our decisions and actions today. It is crucial to have robust regulations in place to ensure ethical use of AI, protect privacy, and maintain transparency and accountability in AI systems. Beyond regulations, we must aspire to a future where AI and Robotics are used to address global challenges, enhance everyday life, and unlock unprecedented possibilities. With careful planning, regulation, and a focus on ethics, we can guide AI and Robotics towards a future that benefits everyone.

So, the next time you‚Äôre engrossed in a sci-fi movie and someone tells you to stop daydreaming about the future, you can confidently reply, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not daydreaming, I‚Äôm conducting research!‚Äù And remember, the next revolutionary idea for AI and Robotics could come from a bowl of popcorn, a comfy couch, and a late-night movie marathon! (Just like the co-founder of Perplexity was inspired by ‚ÄòThe Pirates of Silicon Valley‚Äô.)

By Lakshmi narayana .U on February 15, 2024.

title: BitNet b1.58: Microsoft‚Äôs Approach to Efficient AI
content:
### BitNet b1.58: Microsoft‚Äôs Approach to Efficient AI


Why Smaller, Smarter, and More Sustainable Models May Power the Future of Everyday¬†AI

In the world of vehicles, not everyone needs a large SUV or luxury sedan. For many urban commuters, a compact Mini Cooper or an efficient MG Comet EV provides the perfect balance of functionality and efficiency. These small cars excel in tight city streets, consume less fuel, and cost significantly less to operate‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääall while getting you where you need to go.

The same principle applies to Large Language Models. While massive language models like GPT-4 series or Claude Sonnet series(the ‚Äúluxury SUVs‚Äù of AI) capture headlines with their impressive capabilities, they demand enormous computational resources that put them out of reach for dedicated inference for many applications and users. This is where small language models (SLMs) find their niche.

Microsoft‚Äôs BitNet b1.58 2B4T represents an innovative approach in this space‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääthink of it as the ‚Äúelectric scooter‚Äù of language models. Just as small cars are agile, fuel-efficient, and perfect for navigating narrow European streets or crowded Indian roads, BitNet is lightweight, computationally efficient, and optimized for targeted AI tasks.

The comparison extends further: BitNet‚Äôs stripped-down architecture, using just three possible values for its weights (-1, 0, and +1), mirrors how an electric scooter eliminates everything non-essential to maximize efficiency. The result is remarkably similar too‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääa solution that, while not suitable for every journey, offers impressive capabilities within a fraction of the resource footprint required by its larger counterparts.

What makes this approach significant isn‚Äôt just academic interest in model compression‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääit‚Äôs about democratizing access to AI. When advanced language models can run on standard CPUs rather than specialized hardware, a wider range of developers, researchers, and everyday users can benefit from these technologies.


### What is BitNet b1.58¬†2B4T?


BitNet b1.58 2B4T is a large language model (LLM) developed by Microsoft‚Äôs General Artificial Intelligence group that takes a fundamentally different approach to model architecture. Unlike conventional LLMs that use 16-bit or 32-bit floating-point numbers to represent each weight in the neural network, BitNet constrains its weights to just three discrete values: -1, 0, or +1.

The name itself encodes key technical specifications:

This approach, known as ternary quantization, represents an extreme form of model compression. While most quantization techniques convert models to lower precision after training, BitNet was designed and trained from scratch with these constraints, allowing it to adapt during the learning process.

Architecturally, BitNet builds on the transformer framework with several modifications:

The training process involved three phases:

What makes BitNet unique compared to other compressed models is that it was designed for extreme efficiency from inception, rather than compressing an existing model. This native 1-bit training approach allows it to achieve capabilities that post-training quantization methods typically can‚Äôt match.


### Efficiency by the¬†Numbers


BitNet‚Äôs architecture translates to remarkable efficiency gains across multiple dimensions. Here‚Äôs how it compares to similar-sized models in concrete terms:

Memory Footprint:

This dramatic reduction‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääusing just 15‚Äì30% of the memory required by competitors‚Ää‚Äî‚Äämakes BitNet viable on devices with limited RAM.

Latency (Time per Token):

For real-time applications, BitNet‚Äôs lower latency means more responsive interactions.

Energy Consumption: Based on estimates from the technical report, BitNet uses approximately 85‚Äì96% less energy than full-precision models of similar size. This efficiency comes from two factors:

To put this into perspective, researchers estimate BitNet‚Äôs energy consumption at around 0.028J per inference, compared to 0.186‚Äì0.649J for competitors‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääa reduction that could significantly impact large-scale deployments.

These efficiency gains have practical implications beyond numbers. They enable:

While these benefits come with trade-offs in some aspects of model capability, the efficiency-to-performance ratio represents a compelling alternative for many use cases.


### Performance Assessment


Despite its minimal weight representation, BitNet b1.58 2B4T delivers surprisingly strong performance across a range of benchmarks. The technical report presents comprehensive evaluations across categories including language understanding, reasoning, world knowledge, reading comprehension, mathematics, coding, and conversation.

Language Understanding and Reasoning:

Mathematics and Coding:

Instruction Following and Conversation:

When averaging scores across 11 standard benchmarks, BitNet achieves 54.19%, placing it second only to Qwen2.5 1.5B (55.23%) among the compared models, and ahead of LLaMA 3.2 1B (44.90%), Gemma-3 1B (43.74%), SmolLM2 1.7B (48.70%), and MiniCPM 2B (42.05%).

Most notably, BitNet outperforms not only other native 1-bit models like Bonsai 0.5B and OLMo-Bitnet 1B, but also larger models that were post-training quantized to 1.58-bit, such as Falcon3‚Äì1.58bit 7B.

Let‚Äôs test BitNet on a reasoning task:

While these results are impressive for such an efficient model, it‚Äôs important to note some limitations:

Overall, BitNet proves that extreme quantization doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean sacrificing capability‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääit achieves performance comparable to, and sometimes exceeding, full-precision models of similar size while using a fraction of the resources.


### The bitnet.cpp Framework


Standard deep learning libraries like PyTorch or TensorFlow aren‚Äôt optimized for BitNet‚Äôs unique architecture. To fully realize the efficiency benefits of 1.58-bit weights, Microsoft developed bitnet.cpp, a specialized inference framework designed specifically for BitNet models.

This custom implementation is necessary because standard libraries lack efficient kernels for the mixed-precision, low-bit formats used by BitNet. The framework employs several key innovations:

Weight Packing Strategy: BitNet uses a ‚Äúpack-store-load-unpack-compute‚Äù approach:

The bitnet.cpp library currently focuses on CPU optimization, with GPU support under development. For CPU inference, it achieves remarkable efficiency through:

While this specialized approach delivers optimal performance, it does introduce some practical considerations:

The developers note that future hardware could potentially incorporate dedicated logic for 1-bit operations, which would further enhance the performance advantages of models like BitNet.

Note: It would be nice if LM Studio offers support for this model, currently it doesn‚Äôt. `error loading model: llama_model_loader: failed to load model from /Volumes/LN-1/LMStudio/microsoft/bitnet-b1.58‚Äì2B-4T-gguf/ggml-model-i2_s.gguf`


### Section 5: Hands-On with¬†BitNet


Once BitNet is set up, it‚Äôs straightforward to experiment with its capabilities. Let‚Äôs explore several practical examples of what BitNet can do, from basic text generation to more specific tasks.

Basic Conversation:

This opens an interactive session where you can chat with BitNet. The model responds with coherent, contextually appropriate answers, though with less depth than much larger models like GPT-4.

Creative Writing:

BitNet can generate creative content following specific constraints. The output typically includes a coherent narrative that follows the requested structure, though the quality varies with prompt complexity.

Recommendations and Structured Output:

The model can generate structured recommendations with details like titles, authors, and descriptions. The knowledge is based on its training data rather than real-time information, so some recommendations may reference works from before its training cutoff.

Classification Tasks:

BitNet can handle basic classification tasks like sentiment analysis, providing reasonable judgments about text polarity. For the example above, it correctly identifies the mixed sentiment, typically classifying it as ‚Äúneutral‚Äù or ‚Äúmixed‚Äù with an explanation of the positive and negative aspects.

When using BitNet, a few tips improve results:

While BitNet doesn‚Äôt match the capabilities of models 10‚Äì100x its size, its performance is impressive given its minimal resource requirements. The speed of responses‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääparticularly on CPU-only setups‚Ää‚Äî‚Äästands out compared to larger models that typically require GPU acceleration.


### Practical Applications


BitNet‚Äôs unique combination of efficiency and capability makes it well-suited for several practical applications where resource constraints or accessibility are primary concerns.

Edge Computing and IoT: BitNet‚Äôs 400MB memory footprint enables deployment on edge devices with limited resources. Potential uses include:

Local AI for Privacy and Accessibility: Running AI locally offers several advantages:

For individual users, BitNet could enable personal AI assistants on standard laptops or even older hardware that lacks powerful GPUs.

Research and Academic Settings: BitNet‚Äôs low resource requirements make it valuable in:

Mobile Applications: While not explicitly tested in the technical report, BitNet‚Äôs architecture suggests potential for:

Domain-Specific Applications: For specialized tasks, BitNet can be fine-tuned using significantly less computational resources than larger models require. This makes custom AI more accessible for:

The common thread across these applications is democratizing access to AI capabilities. While BitNet may not match the breadth and depth of much larger models, it provides sufficient functionality for many practical use cases while dramatically lowering the barrier to entry in terms of hardware requirements, technical expertise, and operational costs.


### Future Directions


BitNet b1.58 2B4T represents an important step in efficiency-focused AI, but the research team identifies several promising avenues for future development.

Scaling to Larger Models: A key research question is how the 1-bit approach scales with model size. Future work aims to train larger variants (e.g., 7B, 13B parameters) to determine if:

Extended Context Length: The current 4096 token context window limits BitNet‚Äôs applicability for tasks requiring long-term memory or document analysis. Research is underway to:

Multilingual Capabilities: BitNet‚Äôs current training focused primarily on English data. Expanding to a more globally representative dataset would:

Hardware Co-Design: Perhaps the most transformative future direction involves developing hardware specifically optimized for 1-bit models. The technical report suggests:

Theoretical Understanding: Researchers are investigating why 1-bit models perform so well despite their constraints. Better understanding of:

Could yield insights applicable across the field of efficient AI.

Multimodal Integration: Extending the 1-bit approach to handle multiple modalities (text, images, audio) represents another frontier. Initial explorations suggest potential for:

The open-source nature of BitNet (released under the MIT License) encourages community involvement in these research directions. As the model and its accompanying bitnet.cpp framework continue to develop, they provide a foundation for further innovation in making AI more accessible, efficient, and sustainable.

Like a Mini Cooper or MG Comet EV zipping through city streets, BitNet b1.58 proves that in AI, bigger isn‚Äôt always better. This 2B4T model, trained with ternary weights (-1, 0, +1) at 1.58 bits, delivers language model capabilities rivaling full-precision peers while slashing resource demands: 85‚Äì96% less energy, 70‚Äì90% less memory, and 30‚Äì70% lower latency. These savings translate to real-world impact‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääenabling AI on standard CPUs for small businesses, developers, and resource-constrained settings, all with a smaller environmental footprint.

BitNet isn‚Äôt perfect. Its modest context window and specialized implementation needs, and it can‚Äôt match the raw power of models 10‚Äì100x its size. Yet, its open-source framework invites innovation to address these limits. More than a model, BitNet pioneers a sustainable AI future, balancing efficiency and performance. For developers, researchers, or anyone seeking accessible AI, BitNet shows that big capabilities can come in compact, efficient packages, driving AI toward broader adoption and a greener tomorrow.

title: Using Neo4j and Langchain for Knowledge Graph Creation: A Detailed Guide
content:
### Using Neo4j and Langchain for Knowledge Graph Creation: A Detailed¬†Guide


The Power and Potential of Knowledge Graphs in AI and Data Management

Knowledge graphs are powerful tools for organizing and integrating information. They provide a structured way of representing knowledge, with entities as nodes and relationships as edges. This structured representation allows for efficient querying, analysis, and inference, making knowledge graphs invaluable in a wide range of applications, from search engines and recommendation systems to natural language processing and artificial intelligence.

In the field of AI, for instance, knowledge graphs can help enhance the performance of machine learning models by providing additional contextual information. They can assist in improving the understanding of natural language by mapping out the relationships between different words or phrases. Furthermore, they can aid in the creation of more interactive and intelligent AI systems by providing a rich source of structured information that these systems can draw upon.

Consider a movie database as an example. In a knowledge graph, each movie would be a node. Attributes of the movie, such as its title, release date, and director, would be properties of the node. Other entities, such as actors, would also be nodes, and their connection to the movie would be represented as edges. For instance, an edge could link an actor node to a movie node, labeled with the role the actor played in the movie. This structure allows for complex queries such as ‚Äúfind all movies released in [year] that feature Actor X‚Äù to be answered efficiently. It also allows for insightful analyses, such as identifying patterns in an actor‚Äôs career or understanding trends in movie genres over time. Therefore, a knowledge graph not only organizes the data but also reveals relationships and insights that would be difficult to discover through traditional data analysis methods.

However, constructing and maintaining a knowledge graph is not a trivial task. It involves extracting information from various sources, ensuring the accuracy of this information, and updating the graph as new information becomes available. Despite these challenges, the potential benefits that knowledge graphs offer make them an area of active research and development.

Creating and Implementing Knowledge Graphs Using¬†Neo4j

Creating a knowledge graph follows a structured process that begins with establishing a Minimum Viable Graph (MVG) and then progressively expanding upon it. Let‚Äôs look into how this process unfolds using the example of extracting information from Form 10-K filings:

1. Extract: Initially, relevant information is extracted from Form 10-K filings, a comprehensive annual report filed by publicly traded companies with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). This data is parsed and structured into manageable chunks, which serve as the nodes in the knowledge graph.

2. Enhance: Following extraction, the data undergoes enhancement to enrich its value. Embeddings are added to each chunk, providing additional context and depth to the information. This step is crucial for making the graph more robust and capable of yielding richer insights.

3. Expand: Once the data is enhanced, the graph is ready for expansion. This involves connecting the nodes to each other to expand the context and relationships within the graph. By establishing relationships between pieces of information within the Form 10-K filings, the graph gains complexity and better represents the interconnected nature of the data.

4. Iterative Refinement: The process of extract, enhance, and expand can be repeated as needed, incorporating additional Form 10-K filings, external data sources and users‚Äô feedback to continuously refine and improve the graph‚Äôs relevance and accuracy. This iterative approach ensures that the knowledge graph evolves over time to incorporate new information and meet changing analytical needs.

5. Visual Analysis: In the final stages, Address nodes can be added to the graph, enabling visual analysis and exploration of spatial relationships within the context of Form 10-K filings. This allows for more questions to be answered, such as identifying companies located near each other or analyzing the geographic distribution of investment firms relative to the companies they invest in. The resulting knowledge graph provides valuable insights into various aspects of corporate disclosure and financial reporting.

By following this structured approach and incorporating relevant data from Form 10-K filings, creating a comprehensive and dynamic knowledge graph becomes achievable. Such a graph not only facilitates deeper insights into corporate disclosures but also enables informed decision-making in various domains.

Developing a Basic Knowledge Graph from a Bhagavad Gita Treatise PDF Using Neo4j and Langchain

Let‚Äôs break down how we can use a digital copy of the Bhagavad Gita, a well-known spiritual text, to create a basic knowledge graph. This text, written by Sri Swami Sivananda, is full of rich information that we can organize with a knowledge graph. We‚Äôll use Neo4j, which helps us manage and structure our graph, and Langchain, to help us process the text.

To begin, create a free account with Neo4j. For this example, we‚Äôll be using the free tier, which allows for the creation of one instance.

The credentials file will contain the following details that you will need to use in the subsequent code:

Now let‚Äôs create the knowledge graph.

2. Split Text into Chunks: Next, we split the extracted text into smaller chunks to facilitate further processing. The RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter class from langchain is employed for this purpose.

3. Create a vector store, generate Embeddings and Store in Neo4j: We create a Neo4jVector object to store the embeddings of the text chunks in a Neo4j graph database. This allows us to efficiently retrieve and manipulate the embeddings later on.

4. Construct Relationships: We establish relationships between the chunks within the graph, indicating their sequential order and their association with the parent PDF document.

5. Question & Answering: Finally, we can utilize the constructed knowledge graph to perform question-answering tasks. We create a retriever from the vector store and a chatbot Question & Answer chain to answer questions based on the contents of the PDF document.

Here are a few queries to check the data at neo4j

Printing the schema

Show the indexes

Sample outputs

Neo4j dashboard

Using knowledge graphs along with tools like Neo4j and Langchain, we can convert complex, unstructured texts into structured, interconnected data that‚Äôs easier to analyze. This process can be applied to various types of information, from financial reports to spiritual texts. This example is a basic illustration of how to create a knowledge graph. As we continue to explore and develop this technology, we can discover new ways to understand and interpret data.

title: In early 2000, I set up my own company and put together something called CAPM (Computer Aided‚Ä¶
content:
In early 2000, I set up my own company and put together something called CAPM (Computer Aided Process Management) for the entertainment industry. The idea was to bring in efficiency without touching the creative aspects, while still tracking them. For example, the writing process was untouched, but the output of the writing team was tracked in terms of scenes. It didn‚Äôt take off because of the inherent structure of the movie industry where the output alone mattered, even for the banks/corporates who would typically act like individual finance agents hypothecating the final copy.

Having said that, I was fortunate to check out a few of the old horses and their documentation who were implementing decent systems (paper-based) to track the daily decisions (as an executive would put it) and the typical workflow of signed approvals. During this time, I also looked at some of the ERPs like SAP that claimed to do the process management I was aiming at, and I also evaluated several of the independent tools like MovieMaker, FinalDraft, etc., that worked on certain aspects of movie management.

One reason my software didn‚Äôt succeed was that I didn‚Äôt connect with the right people, including a production firm that was the first to introduce accounting software to the Telugu film industry. Ironically, a few years later, I worked with the same production company (after I shut down my shop) and learned about their accounting software integration.

Speaking of this production firm, there were decent processes to track the film production and the producers even taped all the story discussions for future reference. An assistant would make notes based on this, just in case. This was to me, one way of controlling the creative process, unobtrusively.

The production firm had established effective processes to oversee film production. They went as far as recording all story discussions for future reference, with an assistant taking detailed notes. This approach allowed them to manage the creative process without being intrusive.

After several years since leaving this production firm and working with a TV conglomerate, I find myself revisiting the concept of CAPM against the backdrop of the burgeoning creator economy and the latest advancements in AI. The recent partnership between Lionsgate and RunwayML opens up intriguing possibilities. In this two-part article, I will first discuss the significance of this collaboration and then explore potential real-world applications from a project manager‚Äôs perspective.

title: Finding Fortune and Self: A Philosophical Exploration of Mackenna‚Äôs Gold
content:
### Finding Fortune and Self: A Philosophical Exploration of Mackenna‚Äôs Gold


McKenna‚Äôs Gold is an adventure film released during a time when the technical limitations of filmmaking were more pronounced. However, despite these constraints, the movie manages to create an immersive experience through its captivating storyline and engaging characters. Drawing upon Joseph Campbell‚Äôs hero progression, the protagonist‚Äôs journey in McKenna‚Äôs Gold reflects a profound philosophical exploration of the reluctant hero archetype.

At the heart of the story lies a protagonist who resists his calling, embodying the essence of the reluctant hero. Initially, he doesn‚Äôt want to be a part of the mission, as he is content with his current circumstances and does not seek adventure or glory. This internal conflict adds depth to the character, as it highlights the tension between personal desires and the call to fulfill a greater purpose.

Joseph Campbell‚Äôs hero progression, which encompasses various stages of the hero‚Äôs journey, offers a philosophical lens to analyze the protagonist‚Äôs transformation. The protagonist‚Äôs reluctance and initial resistance align with Campbell‚Äôs ‚ÄúRefusal of the Call‚Äù stage. Here, the hero hesitates to embrace the challenges ahead, clinging to the familiar and the comfortable. This refusal, however, sets the stage for personal growth and discovery.

As the story unfolds, the protagonist‚Äôs true character becomes a guiding force that saves him in the end. Remaining steadfast and true to himself, he navigates the treacherous canyon and passageway in the hills, defying the warnings of the wise Apache old man. This aspect embodies Campbell‚Äôs notion of ‚ÄúThe Hero‚Äôs Ordeal,‚Äù where the hero faces trials that test their resolve and character. By adhering to his principles, the protagonist not only overcomes the physical obstacles but also triumphs over his internal struggles.

In a beautiful symbolic twist, the pot of gold at the rainbow‚Äôs end serves as a fitting reward for the protagonist‚Äôs journey. This evokes the idea of the hero‚Äôs ultimate boon, as described by Joseph Campbell. The treasure represents not only material wealth but also the fulfillment of the protagonist‚Äôs inner desires, acquired through his transformative journey. It serves as a reminder that the hero‚Äôs quest is not solely about external accomplishments but also about the discovery of self and the realization of one‚Äôs true potential.

Despite the technical limitations inherent to the time it was made, McKenna‚Äôs Gold manages to incorporate these philosophical elements, offering a thought-provoking exploration of the reluctant hero archetype within the framework of Joseph Campbell‚Äôs hero progression. This convergence of storytelling and philosophy elevates the film beyond its technical shortcomings, making it a captivating and enduring cinematic experience.

title: The Future of Research in an AI-Powered World# DeerFlow: A Revolution in AI-Powered Research‚Ä¶
content:
### The Future of Research in an AI-Powered World# DeerFlow: A Revolution in AI-Powered Research Methodology


The DeerFlow framework represents a significant advancement in how researchers can harness AI for information processing

As researchers across disciplines contend with the mounting challenge of information overload, a new open-source framework is gaining attention for its innovative approach to deep research. DeerFlow, developed as a community-driven project, combines language models with specialized tools to transform how academic and professional researchers gather, analyze, and present information.

Much like the scene in ‚Äú2001: A Space Odyssey‚Äù (1968) where the mysterious monolith catalyzes an evolutionary leap for humanity, DeerFlow aims to significantly advance research methodology. While not quite as enigmatic as Kubrick‚Äôs monolith, this framework does offer researchers capabilities that might have seemed like science fiction just a few years ago.


### The Architecture of Augmented Research


DeerFlow distinguishes itself from conventional AI research tools through its orchestrated multi-agent architecture. The system does not merely search and summarize; rather, it implements a sophisticated framework that simulates the collaborative efforts of a professional research team.

The foundational concept is elegant but powerful: integrate language models with specialized tools for web search, crawling, and Python code execution while maintaining human oversight throughout the process. This approach enables researchers to access the computational efficiency of AI while retaining control over the investigative direction.

Dr. Eleanor Richards, Professor of Information Sciences at Stanford University, notes: ‚ÄúDeerFlow represents a paradigm shift in how we conceptualize human-AI collaboration in research contexts. The multi-agent approach is particularly promising.‚Äù


### The Multi-Agent Orchestration: A Symphony of Specialized Components


DeerFlow‚Äôs architecture consists of five primary components that work in concert, reminiscent of the intricately coordinated heist team in ‚ÄúOcean‚Äôs 11‚Äù (1960), each with specialized skills and clearly defined roles:

The Coordinator functions as the entry point, managing the entire workflow. This component processes the initial research question and orchestrates the subsequent investigative process from initiation to completion.

The Planner serves as the strategic element, methodically deconstructing research questions into manageable components and creating structured execution plans that can be reviewed and modified by the human researcher.

The Researcher is tasked with information retrieval, efficiently gathering data from diverse sources through web search capabilities, crawling functions, and specialized databases.

The Coder handles technical analysis, writing, testing, and executing Python code when quantitative processing is required, enabling data visualization and pattern recognition.

The Reporter synthesizes the collected information into comprehensive, well-structured reports optimized for clarity and coherence.

DeerFlow‚Äôs multi-agent system functions as a coordinated research team, with each component fulfilling specialized roles


### Technical Implementation: From Repository to Functional System


Implementing DeerFlow requires specific technical steps, clearly documented in the GitHub repository. The installation process involves several key procedures:

For the web interface, additional Node.js dependencies must be installed:

The configuration process typically requires approximately 20‚Äì30 minutes, primarily allocated to acquiring the necessary API keys for search functionality (Tavily or Brave Search being the preferred options) and language model access.


### Google Colab Implementation: Exploration Without Full Installation


For researchers interested in evaluating DeerFlow‚Äôs capabilities without committing to a complete installation, Google Colab offers an expedient alternative. This approach, while not providing the full experience of the web interface, enables a preliminary assessment of the framework‚Äôs core functionality.

A sample implementation in Google Colab might be structured as follows:

While the output appears directly in Colab cells without the polished presentation of the web interface, this approach provides sufficient insight into DeerFlow‚Äôs research capabilities to determine whether a full installation is warranted.


### Operational Workflow: The Research Process Reimagined


Perhaps the most thoughtful aspect of DeerFlow is how it keeps humans at the center of the research process.

Unlike black-box AI systems that provide answers without explanation, DeerFlow makes its thinking visible. You can review plans before execution, provide feedback on approaches, and even redirect investigations mid-course if you spot a promising avenue.

The GitHub documentation explains this human-in-the-loop mechanism:

This approach ensures that the research remains guided by human expertise while leveraging the computational power of AI. It‚Äôs not replacement‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääit‚Äôs augmentation.


### From Scattered Research to Structured Reports


After using DeerFlow for several weeks, here‚Äôs how it transformed my research process:

My favorite feature remains the human-in-the-loop planning. Being able to review and modify research plans before execution ensures that the final output aligns precisely with my needs.

As one GitHub contributor commented in an issue I read, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not about AI doing the research for you; it‚Äôs about AI doing the tedious parts so you can do the meaningful parts better.‚Äù


### Getting Started: Installation Steps¬†Recap


As DeerFlow continues to evolve, it represents a new paradigm in how we approach complex information challenges. By combining specialized AI agents with human guidance, it creates a partnership that leverages the strengths of both.

For students drowning in information, professionals needing quick but thorough analysis, or researchers exploring new territories, DeerFlow offers something precious: not just answers, but a better way to find them.

The project‚Äôs open-source nature is also worth highlighting. As noted in the GitHub repository:

This community-driven approach ensures that DeerFlow will continue to improve as more researchers contribute to its development.


### My Experience: Worth the¬†Setup


Setting up DeerFlow does require some technical knowledge and time investment, primarily in configuring API keys and understanding the options. But for anyone who regularly conducts research‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääwhether for academic, business, or personal purposes‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääthe payoff is substantial.

In my case, what sold me on the tool was its first output: a comprehensive analysis of renewable energy market trends that would have taken me days to compile manually. The report included data I might have missed, visualizations I wouldn‚Äôt have thought to create, and a structure that made complex information accessible.

Is it perfect? No. You‚Äôll still need to review the outputs carefully, and occasionally the system might need guidance to get back on track. But that‚Äôs precisely the point‚Ää‚Äî‚ÄäDeerFlow is designed to be a collaborative tool, not a replacement for human judgment.

In a world overflowing with information, perhaps what we needed wasn‚Äôt just more powerful search engines, but a more thoughtful approach to the entire research process‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääfrom question to conclusion, with human wisdom guiding artificial intelligence every step of the way.

And that‚Äôs exactly what DeerFlow delivers.

Have you tried DeerFlow or similar research tools? Share your experiences in the comments below. And if you found this article helpful, consider sharing it with colleagues who might benefit from a new approach to research.
